content: 1 The proverbs of Solomon､ son of David, King of Israel:
content_old: 1 The proverbs of Solomon､ son of David, King of Israel:

content: 2 For the knowledge of wisdom and correction, For discerning the sayings of intelligence;
content_old: 2 For the knowledge of wisdom and correction, For discerning the sayings of intelligence;

content: 3 For receiving the correction of prudence, Righteousness and justice, and equity;
content_old: 3 For receiving the correction of prudence, Righteousness and justice, and equity;

content: 4 For giving To the simple shrewdness, To the young man､ knowledge and discretion.
content_old: 4 For giving To the simple shrewdness, To the young man､ knowledge and discretion.

content: 5 A wise man will hear､ and will increase learning, And a discreet man wise counsels will acquire,
content_old: 5 A wise man will hear､ and will increase learning, And a discreet man wise counsels will acquire,

content: 6 By gaining discernment of proverb､ and satire, The words of the wise､ and their dark sayings.
content_old: 6 By gaining discernment of proverb､ and satire, The words of the wise､ and their dark sayings.

content: 7 The reverence of Yahweh is the beginning of knowledge, Wisdom and correction the foolish have despised.
content_old: 7 The reverence of Yahweh is the beginning of knowledge, Wisdom and correction the foolish have despised.

content: 8 Hear､ my son､ the correction of thy father, And do not reject the instruction of thy mother;
content_old: 8 Hear､ my son､ the correction of thy father, And do not reject the instruction of thy mother;

content: 9 For a wreath of beauty shall they be to thy head, And chains of ornament､ to thy neck.
content_old: 9 For a wreath of beauty shall they be to thy head, And chains of ornament､ to thy neck.

content: 10 My son､ if sinners entice thee do not consent.
content_old: 10 My son､ if sinners entice thee do not consent.

content: 11 If they say— Come with us,— Let us lie in wait for blood, Let us watch in secret for him who is needlessly innocent;
content_old: 11 If they say— Come with us,— Let us lie in wait for blood, Let us watch in secret for him who is needlessly innocent;

content: 12 Let us engulf them､ like hades､ alive, While in health like them who are going down to the pit;
content_old: 12 Let us engulf them､ like hades､ alive, While in health like them who are going down to the pit;

content: 13 All costly substance shall we find, We shall fill our houses with spoil;
content_old: 13 All costly substance shall we find, We shall fill our houses with spoil;

content: 14 Thy lot shalt thou cast into our midst, One purse shall there be for us all!
content_old: 14 Thy lot shalt thou cast into our midst, One purse shall there be for us all!

content: 15 My son､ do not walk in the way with them, Withhold thy foot from their path.
content_old: 15 My son､ do not walk in the way with them, Withhold thy foot from their path.

content: 16 For their feet to mischief do run, And haste to the shedding of blood.
content_old: 16 For their feet to mischief do run, And haste to the shedding of blood.

content: 17 Surely in vain is spread the net, In the sight of aught that hath wings!
content_old: 17 Surely in vain is spread the net, In the sight of aught that hath wings!

content: 18 Yet they for their own blood lie in wait, They watch in secret for their own life.
content_old: 18 Yet they for their own blood lie in wait, They watch in secret for their own life.

content: 19 Such are the ways of every one that graspeth with greed, The life of the owners thereof it taketh away!
content_old: 19 Such are the ways of every one that graspeth with greed, The life of the owners thereof it taketh away!

content: 20 Wisdom in the open place soundeth forth, In the broadways she raiseth her voice;
content_old: 20 Wisdom in the open place soundeth forth, In the broadways she raiseth her voice;

content: 21 At the head of bustling streets she crieth aloud,— At the openings of the gates in the city—her sayings she doth utter:—
content_old: 21 At the head of bustling streets she crieth aloud,— At the openings of the gates in the city—her sayings she doth utter:—

content: 22 How long､ ye simple ones､ will ye love simplicity? And scoffers in scoffing delight them? And dullards hate knowledge?
content_old: 22 How long､ ye simple ones､ will ye love simplicity? And scoffers in scoffing delight them? And dullards hate knowledge?

content: 23 Will ye turn､ at my reproof? Lo! I will pour out to you my spirit, I will make known my words to you.
content_old: 23 Will ye turn､ at my reproof? Lo! I will pour out to you my spirit, I will make known my words to you.

content: 24 Because I called､ and ye refused, I stretched out my hand､ and no one regarded;
content_old: 24 Because I called､ and ye refused, I stretched out my hand､ and no one regarded;

content: 25 But ye dismissed all my counsel, And to my rebuke would not yield
content_old: 25 But ye dismissed all my counsel, And to my rebuke would not yield

content: 26 I also at your calamity will laugh, I will mock､ when cometh your dread;
content_old: 26 I also at your calamity will laugh, I will mock､ when cometh your dread;

content: 27 When cometh as a crashing your dread､ And your calamity as a storm-wind overtaketh, When there come upon you､ distress and anguish.
content_old: 27 When cometh as a crashing your dread､ And your calamity as a storm-wind overtaketh, When there come upon you､ distress and anguish.

content: 28 Then will they call me､ but I will not answer, They will seek me diligently､ but shall not find me.
content_old: 28 Then will they call me､ but I will not answer, They will seek me diligently､ but shall not find me.

content: 29 Because they hated knowledge, And the reverence of Yahweh did not choose;
content_old: 29 Because they hated knowledge, And the reverence of Yahweh did not choose;

content: 30 Consented not to my counsel, Disdained all my rebuke
content_old: 30 Consented not to my counsel, Disdained all my rebuke

content: 31 Therefore shall they eat of the fruit of their own way, And with their own counsels be filled.
content_old: 31 Therefore shall they eat of the fruit of their own way, And with their own counsels be filled.

content: 32 For the turning away of the simple will slay them,— And the carelessness of dullards will destroy them.
content_old: 32 For the turning away of the simple will slay them,— And the carelessness of dullards will destroy them.

content: 1 My son､ if thou wilt receive my sayings, And my commandments wilt treasure up by thee;
content_old: 1 My son､ if thou wilt receive my sayings, And my commandments wilt treasure up by thee;

content: 2 So that thou Direct､ unto wisdom､ thine ear, Bend thy heart､ unto understanding;
content_old: 2 So that thou Direct､ unto wisdom､ thine ear, Bend thy heart､ unto understanding;

content: 3 Yea if for understanding thou cry aloud, For knowledge utter thy voice;
content_old: 3 Yea if for understanding thou cry aloud, For knowledge utter thy voice;

content: 4 If thou seek her as silver, And like hid treasure thou search for her
content_old: 4 If thou seek her as silver, And like hid treasure thou search for her

content: 5 Then shalt thou understand the reverence of Yahweh, And the knowledge of God shalt thou find.
content_old: 5 Then shalt thou understand the reverence of Yahweh, And the knowledge of God shalt thou find.

content: 6 For Yahweh giveth wisdom, Out of his mouth knowledge and understanding;
content_old: 6 For Yahweh giveth wisdom, Out of his mouth knowledge and understanding;

content: 7 Yea he treasureth､ for the upright､ safety, A shield is he to them who walk in integrity.
content_old: 7 Yea he treasureth､ for the upright､ safety, A shield is he to them who walk in integrity.

content: 8 To him that observeth the paths of justice, Yea the way of his men of lovingkindness he doth guard.
content_old: 8 To him that observeth the paths of justice, Yea the way of his men of lovingkindness he doth guard.

content: 9 Then shalt thou understand righteousness and justice, And equity—every noble course.
content_old: 9 Then shalt thou understand righteousness and justice, And equity—every noble course.

content: 10 When wisdom entereth thy heart, And knowledge to thy soul is sweet
content_old: 10 When wisdom entereth thy heart, And knowledge to thy soul is sweet

content: 11 Discretion shall watch over thee, Understanding shall preserve thee:—
content_old: 11 Discretion shall watch over thee, Understanding shall preserve thee:—

content: 12 To rescue thee from the way of the wrongful, From the man that speaketh perverse things;
content_old: 12 To rescue thee from the way of the wrongful, From the man that speaketh perverse things;

content: 13 From them who forsake the paths of rectitude, To walk in the ways of darkness;
content_old: 13 From them who forsake the paths of rectitude, To walk in the ways of darkness;

content: 14 Who rejoice to do wrong, Exult in the perversities of the wrongful;
content_old: 14 Who rejoice to do wrong, Exult in the perversities of the wrongful;

content: 15 Whose paths are twisted, And they are tortuous in their tracks:
content_old: 15 Whose paths are twisted, And they are tortuous in their tracks:

content: 16 To rescue thee､ from the woman that is a stranger, From the female unknown､ who with her speeches seduceth;
content_old: 16 To rescue thee､ from the woman that is a stranger, From the female unknown､ who with her speeches seduceth;

content: 17 Who forsaketh the friend of her youth, And the covenant of her God hath forgotten;
content_old: 17 Who forsaketh the friend of her youth, And the covenant of her God hath forgotten;

content: 18 For she hath appointed､ unto death､ her house, And unto the shades､ her courses;
content_old: 18 For she hath appointed､ unto death､ her house, And unto the shades､ her courses;

content: 19 None who go in unto her come back, Neither attain they unto the paths of life:
content_old: 19 None who go in unto her come back, Neither attain they unto the paths of life:

content: 20 To the end that thou walk in the way of good men, And the paths of the righteous that thou observe.
content_old: 20 To the end that thou walk in the way of good men, And the paths of the righteous that thou observe.

content: 21 For the upright shall abide on the earth,— And the men of integrity shall remain therein;
content_old: 21 For the upright shall abide on the earth,— And the men of integrity shall remain therein;

content: 1 My son､ mine instruction do not thou forget, And my commandment let thy heart observe;
content_old: 1 My son､ mine instruction do not thou forget, And my commandment let thy heart observe;

content: 2 For length of days and years of life, And blessedness shall they add to thee.
content_old: 2 For length of days and years of life, And blessedness shall they add to thee.

content: 3 Lovingkindness and faithfulness let them not forsake thee,— Bind them､ upon thy neck, Write them upon the tablet of thy heart:
content_old: 3 Lovingkindness and faithfulness let them not forsake thee,— Bind them､ upon thy neck, Write them upon the tablet of thy heart:

content: 4 So find thou favour and good repute, In the eyes of God and man.
content_old: 4 So find thou favour and good repute, In the eyes of God and man.

content: 5 Trust thou in Yahweh､ with all thy heart, And unto thine own understanding do not lean:
content_old: 5 Trust thou in Yahweh､ with all thy heart, And unto thine own understanding do not lean:

content: 6 In all thy ways acknowledge him, And he will make straight thy paths.
content_old: 6 In all thy ways acknowledge him, And he will make straight thy paths.

content: 7 Do not become wise in thine own eyes､ Revere Yahweh､ and avoid evil:
content_old: 7 Do not become wise in thine own eyes､ Revere Yahweh､ and avoid evil:

content: 8 Healing shall it be to thy body, And refreshing､ to thy bones.
content_old: 8 Healing shall it be to thy body, And refreshing､ to thy bones.

content: 9 Honour thou Yahweh､ with thy substance, And with the firstfruit of all thine increase;
content_old: 9 Honour thou Yahweh､ with thy substance, And with the firstfruit of all thine increase;

content: 10 So shall thy storehouses be filled with plenty, And with new wine shall thy vats overflow.
content_old: 10 So shall thy storehouses be filled with plenty, And with new wine shall thy vats overflow.

content: 11 The chastening of Yahweh my son､ do not reject, Nor loathe his rebuke;
content_old: 11 The chastening of Yahweh my son､ do not reject, Nor loathe his rebuke;

content: 12 For whom Yahweh loveth he correcteth, He causeth pain to the son in whom he delighteth.
content_old: 12 For whom Yahweh loveth he correcteth, He causeth pain to the son in whom he delighteth.

content: 13 How happy the man who hath found wisdom, And the man who draweth forth understanding,
content_old: 13 How happy the man who hath found wisdom, And the man who draweth forth understanding,

content: 14 For better is her merchandise､ than the merchandise of silver, Yea than gold her increase;
content_old: 14 For better is her merchandise､ than the merchandise of silver, Yea than gold her increase;

content: 15 More precious is she､ than corals, Yea none of thy delightful things doth equal her:
content_old: 15 More precious is she､ than corals, Yea none of thy delightful things doth equal her:

content: 16 Length of days is in her right hand, In her left are riches and honour;
content_old: 16 Length of days is in her right hand, In her left are riches and honour;

content: 17 Her ways are ways of pleasantness, And all her paths are peace;
content_old: 17 Her ways are ways of pleasantness, And all her paths are peace;

content: 18 A tree of life is she､ to them who secure her,— And they who hold her fast are every one to be pronounced happy.
content_old: 18 A tree of life is she､ to them who secure her,— And they who hold her fast are every one to be pronounced happy.

content: 19 Yahweh in wisdom founded the earth, Establishing the heavens with understanding;
content_old: 19 Yahweh in wisdom founded the earth, Establishing the heavens with understanding;

content: 20 By his knowledge the resounding deeps were burst open, And the skies drop down dew.
content_old: 20 By his knowledge the resounding deeps were burst open, And the skies drop down dew.

content: 21 My son､ let them not depart from thine eyes, Guard thou counsel､ and purpose:
content_old: 21 My son､ let them not depart from thine eyes, Guard thou counsel､ and purpose:

content: 22 So shall they become life to thy soul, And an adorning to thy neck;
content_old: 22 So shall they become life to thy soul, And an adorning to thy neck;

content: 23 Then shalt thou walk securely in thy way, And thy foot shall not stumble;
content_old: 23 Then shalt thou walk securely in thy way, And thy foot shall not stumble;

content: 24 When thou sittest down thou shalt have no dread, Yea thou shalt lie down､ and sweet shall be thy sleep.
content_old: 24 When thou sittest down thou shalt have no dread, Yea thou shalt lie down､ and sweet shall be thy sleep.

content: 25 Be not thou afraid of sudden dread, Nor of the desolation of the lawless, when it cometh.
content_old: 25 Be not thou afraid of sudden dread, Nor of the desolation of the lawless, when it cometh.

content: 26 For Yahweh will be in all thy ways, And will keep thy foot from the snare.
content_old: 26 For Yahweh will be in all thy ways, And will keep thy foot from the snare.

content: 27 Withhold not good from them who ask it, When it is in power of thy hand to do it:
content_old: 27 Withhold not good from them who ask it, When it is in power of thy hand to do it:

content: 28 Do not say to thy neighbour､ Go and come again､ And to-morrow I will give, When thou hast it by thee.
content_old: 28 Do not say to thy neighbour､ Go and come again､ And to-morrow I will give, When thou hast it by thee.

content: 29 Devise not against thy neighbour an injury, Seeing that he dwelleth securely by thee.
content_old: 29 Devise not against thy neighbour an injury, Seeing that he dwelleth securely by thee.

content: 30 Contend not with a man without cause, If he hath dealt thee no wrong.
content_old: 30 Contend not with a man without cause, If he hath dealt thee no wrong.

content: 31 Do not thou envy the man of violence, Neither choose thou any of his ways;
content_old: 31 Do not thou envy the man of violence, Neither choose thou any of his ways;

content: 32 For an abomination to Yahweh is the tortuous man, But with the upright he is intimate.
content_old: 32 For an abomination to Yahweh is the tortuous man, But with the upright he is intimate.

content: 33 The curse of Yahweh is in the house of the lawless one, But the home of the righteous he blesseth.
content_old: 33 The curse of Yahweh is in the house of the lawless one, But the home of the righteous he blesseth.

content: 34 Though at scoffers he scoffeth Yet to the humbled he granteth favour.
content_old: 34 Though at scoffers he scoffeth Yet to the humbled he granteth favour.

content: 1 Hear､ ye sons､ the correction of a father, And attend､ that ye may know understanding.
content_old: 1 Hear､ ye sons､ the correction of a father, And attend､ that ye may know understanding.

content: 2 For good teaching have I given you, Mine instruction do not ye forsake.
content_old: 2 For good teaching have I given you, Mine instruction do not ye forsake.

content: 3 For a son became I to my father, Tender and most precious in the sight of my mother.
content_old: 3 For a son became I to my father, Tender and most precious in the sight of my mother.

content: 4 So he taught me､ and said to me— Let thy heart lay hold of my words, Keep my commandments and live!
content_old: 4 So he taught me､ and said to me— Let thy heart lay hold of my words, Keep my commandments and live!

content: 5 Acquire wisdom､ acquire understanding, Do not forget, neither decline thou from the sayings of my mouth.
content_old: 5 Acquire wisdom､ acquire understanding, Do not forget, neither decline thou from the sayings of my mouth.

content: 6 Do not forsake her､ and she will guard thee,— Love her and she will keep thee.
content_old: 6 Do not forsake her､ and she will guard thee,— Love her and she will keep thee.

content: 7 The principal thing is wisdom､ acquire thou wisdom, With all thine acquisition acquire thou understanding.
content_old: 7 The principal thing is wisdom､ acquire thou wisdom, With all thine acquisition acquire thou understanding.

content: 8 Exalt her､ and she will set thee on high, She will bring thee to honour､ when thou dost embrace her:
content_old: 8 Exalt her､ and she will set thee on high, She will bring thee to honour､ when thou dost embrace her:

content: 9 She will give for thy head､ a wreath of beauty, A crown of adorning will she bestow upon thee.
content_old: 9 She will give for thy head､ a wreath of beauty, A crown of adorning will she bestow upon thee.

content: 10 Hear, my son､ and receive my sayings, And they will multiply to thee the years of life.
content_old: 10 Hear, my son､ and receive my sayings, And they will multiply to thee the years of life.

content: 11 In the way of wisdom have I taught thee, I have guided thee in tracks of uprightness.
content_old: 11 In the way of wisdom have I taught thee, I have guided thee in tracks of uprightness.

content: 12 When thou walkest thy step shall not be hemmed in, And if thou runnest thou shalt not stumble.
content_old: 12 When thou walkest thy step shall not be hemmed in, And if thou runnest thou shalt not stumble.

content: 13 Take fast hold of correction､ let her not go,— Keep her､ for she is thy life.
content_old: 13 Take fast hold of correction､ let her not go,— Keep her､ for she is thy life.

content: 14 Upon the path of the lawless do not thou enter, And do not advance in the way of the wicked:
content_old: 14 Upon the path of the lawless do not thou enter, And do not advance in the way of the wicked:

content: 15 Avoid it､ do not pass thereon— Turn from it､ and depart.
content_old: 15 Avoid it､ do not pass thereon— Turn from it､ and depart.

content: 16 For they sleep not､ unless they can do mischief,— They rob themselves of their sleep､ if they cannot cause someone to stumble.
content_old: 16 For they sleep not､ unless they can do mischief,— They rob themselves of their sleep､ if they cannot cause someone to stumble.

content: 17 For they consume bread gotten by lawlessness, And wine obtained by violence they drink.
content_old: 17 For they consume bread gotten by lawlessness, And wine obtained by violence they drink.

content: 18 But the path of the righteous is as the light of dawn,— Going on and brightening, unto meridian day.
content_old: 18 But the path of the righteous is as the light of dawn,— Going on and brightening, unto meridian day.

content: 19 The way of the lawless is like darkness, They know not､ at what they stumble.
content_old: 19 The way of the lawless is like darkness, They know not､ at what they stumble.

content: 20 My son to my words attend, To my sayings incline thou thine ear;
content_old: 20 My son to my words attend, To my sayings incline thou thine ear;

content: 21 Let them not depart from thine eyes, Keep them in the midst of thy heart;
content_old: 21 Let them not depart from thine eyes, Keep them in the midst of thy heart;

content: 22 For life they are､ to them who find them,— And to every part of one’s flesh they bring healing.
content_old: 22 For life they are､ to them who find them,— And to every part of one’s flesh they bring healing.

content: 23 Above all that must be guarded keep thou thy heart, For out of it are the issues of life.
content_old: 23 Above all that must be guarded keep thou thy heart, For out of it are the issues of life.

content: 24 Remove from thee､ perverseness of mouth, And craftiness of lips put far from thee.
content_old: 24 Remove from thee､ perverseness of mouth, And craftiness of lips put far from thee.

content: 25 Let thine eyes|| right onward look,— And thine eyelashes point straight before thee.
content_old: 25 Let thine eyes|| right onward look,— And thine eyelashes point straight before thee.

content: 26 Make level the track of thy foot, That all thy ways may be directed aright:
content_old: 26 Make level the track of thy foot, That all thy ways may be directed aright:

content: 1 My son､ to my wisdom attend, And to mine understanding incline thou thine ear:
content_old: 1 My son､ to my wisdom attend, And to mine understanding incline thou thine ear:

content: 2 That thou mayest preserve discretion,— And as for knowledge that thy lips may guard it.
content_old: 2 That thou mayest preserve discretion,— And as for knowledge that thy lips may guard it.

content: 3 For with sweet droppings drip the lips of her that is a stranger, And smoother than oil is her mouth;
content_old: 3 For with sweet droppings drip the lips of her that is a stranger, And smoother than oil is her mouth;

content: 4 But the latter end of her is bitter as worm-wood, Sharp､ as a two-edged sword!
content_old: 4 But the latter end of her is bitter as worm-wood, Sharp､ as a two-edged sword!

content: 5 Her feet are going down to death,— On hades will her steps take firm hold.
content_old: 5 Her feet are going down to death,— On hades will her steps take firm hold.

content: 6 Lest the path of life she should ponder Her tracks have wandered she knoweth not whither.
content_old: 6 Lest the path of life she should ponder Her tracks have wandered she knoweth not whither.

content: 7 Now therefore､ ye sons､ hearken unto me, And do not turn away from the sayings of my mouth.
content_old: 7 Now therefore､ ye sons､ hearken unto me, And do not turn away from the sayings of my mouth.

content: 8 Keep far from her thy way, And do not go near the opening of her house:
content_old: 8 Keep far from her thy way, And do not go near the opening of her house:

content: 9 Lest thou give､ to other men､ thy vigour, And thy years､ to him that is cruel:
content_old: 9 Lest thou give､ to other men､ thy vigour, And thy years､ to him that is cruel:

content: 10 Lest strange men be well fed by thy strength, And thy toils be in the house of the alien.
content_old: 10 Lest strange men be well fed by thy strength, And thy toils be in the house of the alien.

content: 11 So shalt thou grieve in thy latter end, In the failing of thy flesh and of thy healthy condition;
content_old: 11 So shalt thou grieve in thy latter end, In the failing of thy flesh and of thy healthy condition;

content: 12 And thou shalt say— How I hated correction! And reproof my heart disdained;
content_old: 12 And thou shalt say— How I hated correction! And reproof my heart disdained;

content: 13 Neither hearkened I to the voice of my teachers, Nor to my instructors inclined I mine ear:
content_old: 13 Neither hearkened I to the voice of my teachers, Nor to my instructors inclined I mine ear:

content: 14 Soon was I in all evil, In the midst of convocation and assembly.
content_old: 14 Soon was I in all evil, In the midst of convocation and assembly.

content: 15 Drink thou water out of thine own cistern, And flowing streams out of the midst of thine own well.
content_old: 15 Drink thou water out of thine own cistern, And flowing streams out of the midst of thine own well.

content: 16 Let not thy fountains flow over abroad In the streets､ dividings of waters:
content_old: 16 Let not thy fountains flow over abroad In the streets､ dividings of waters:

content: 17 Let them be for thyself alone,— And not for strangers with thee.
content_old: 17 Let them be for thyself alone,— And not for strangers with thee.

content: 18 Let thy well-spring be blessed,— And get thy joy from the wife of thy youth:—
content_old: 18 Let thy well-spring be blessed,— And get thy joy from the wife of thy youth:—

content: 19 A loving hind! a graceful doe! Let her bosom content thee at all times, And in her love mayst thou stray evermore.
content_old: 19 A loving hind! a graceful doe! Let her bosom content thee at all times, And in her love mayst thou stray evermore.

content: 20 Wherefore､ then､ shouldst thou stray､ my son､ with a strange woman? Or embrace the bosom of a woman unknown?
content_old: 20 Wherefore､ then､ shouldst thou stray､ my son､ with a strange woman? Or embrace the bosom of a woman unknown?

content: 21 For before the eyes of Yahweh are the ways of a man,— And all his tracks doth he consider:
content_old: 21 For before the eyes of Yahweh are the ways of a man,— And all his tracks doth he consider:

content: 22 His own iniquities shall entrap him with the lawless, And by the cords of his own sin shall he be seized.
content_old: 22 His own iniquities shall entrap him with the lawless, And by the cords of his own sin shall he be seized.

content: 1 My son if thou have become surety for thy neighbour,— have struck for a stranger thy hands
content_old: 1 My son if thou have become surety for thy neighbour,— have struck for a stranger thy hands

content: 2 Thou hast been snared by the sayings of thy mouth,— Thou hast been caught by the sayings of thy mouth.
content_old: 2 Thou hast been snared by the sayings of thy mouth,— Thou hast been caught by the sayings of thy mouth.

content: 3 Do this then､ my son､ and deliver thyself､ When thou hast come into the hand of thy neighbour, Go､ haste thee､ and urge thy neighbour;
content_old: 3 Do this then､ my son､ and deliver thyself､ When thou hast come into the hand of thy neighbour, Go､ haste thee､ and urge thy neighbour;

content: 4 Do not give Sleep to thine eyes, or Slumber to thine eyelashes;
content_old: 4 Do not give Sleep to thine eyes, or Slumber to thine eyelashes;

content: 5 Deliver thyself､ as a gazelle out of the hand, And as a bird､ out of the hand of the fowler.
content_old: 5 Deliver thyself､ as a gazelle out of the hand, And as a bird､ out of the hand of the fowler.

content: 6 Go to the ant､ thou sluggard, Observe her ways､ and be wise;
content_old: 6 Go to the ant､ thou sluggard, Observe her ways､ and be wise;

content: 7 Which､ having no harvest､ scribe, or ruler
content_old: 7 Which､ having no harvest､ scribe, or ruler

content: 8 Prepareth in the summer her food, Hath collected in the harvest her sustenance.
content_old: 8 Prepareth in the summer her food, Hath collected in the harvest her sustenance.

content: 9 How long､ O sluggard､ wilt thou lie? How long ere thou rise from thy sleep?
content_old: 9 How long､ O sluggard､ wilt thou lie? How long ere thou rise from thy sleep?

content: 10 A little sleep､ a little slumber, A little folding of the hands to rest:—
content_old: 10 A little sleep､ a little slumber, A little folding of the hands to rest:—

content: 11 So shall come in､ as a highwayman､ thy poverty, And thy want as one armed with a shield.
content_old: 11 So shall come in､ as a highwayman､ thy poverty, And thy want as one armed with a shield.

content: 12 An abandoned man､ a man of iniquity is he who— Goeth on in perversity of mouth;
content_old: 12 An abandoned man､ a man of iniquity is he who— Goeth on in perversity of mouth;

content: 13 Winketh with his eyes､ Speaketh with his foot, Pointeth with his fingers;
content_old: 13 Winketh with his eyes､ Speaketh with his foot, Pointeth with his fingers;

content: 14 Hath perverse things in his heart､ Deviseth mischief on every occasion, Strifes he sendeth forth.
content_old: 14 Hath perverse things in his heart､ Deviseth mischief on every occasion, Strifes he sendeth forth.

content: 15 For this cause suddenly cometh his doom, In a moment shall he be torn in pieces and there be no mending.
content_old: 15 For this cause suddenly cometh his doom, In a moment shall he be torn in pieces and there be no mending.

content: 16 These six things doth Yahweh hate, Yea seven are the abomination of his soul:—
content_old: 16 These six things doth Yahweh hate, Yea seven are the abomination of his soul:—

content: 17 Eyes that are lofty､ A tongue that is false, And hands shedding innocent blood;
content_old: 17 Eyes that are lofty､ A tongue that is false, And hands shedding innocent blood;

content: 18 A heart contriving iniquitous devices, Feet hasting to run into mischief;
content_old: 18 A heart contriving iniquitous devices, Feet hasting to run into mischief;

content: 19 One that uttereth lies—a false witness, And one sending forth strifes between brethren.
content_old: 19 One that uttereth lies—a false witness, And one sending forth strifes between brethren.

content: 20 Observe thou､ my son､ the commandment of thy father, And do not decline from the instruction of thy mother:
content_old: 20 Observe thou､ my son､ the commandment of thy father, And do not decline from the instruction of thy mother:

content: 21 Bind them upon thy heart continually, Fasten them upon thy neck;
content_old: 21 Bind them upon thy heart continually, Fasten them upon thy neck;

content: 22 When thou walkest abroad it shall guide thee､ When thou sleepest it shall watch over thee, When thou wakest it shall speak to thee:
content_old: 22 When thou walkest abroad it shall guide thee､ When thou sleepest it shall watch over thee, When thou wakest it shall speak to thee:

content: 23 For a lamp is the commandment､ And the instruction a light, And the way of life are the reproofs of correction:
content_old: 23 For a lamp is the commandment､ And the instruction a light, And the way of life are the reproofs of correction:

content: 24 To keep thee from the wicked woman, From the flattery of the tongue of her that is a stranger.
content_old: 24 To keep thee from the wicked woman, From the flattery of the tongue of her that is a stranger.

content: 25 Do not covet her beauty､ in thy heart, Neither let her take thee､ by her eyelashes;
content_old: 25 Do not covet her beauty､ in thy heart, Neither let her take thee､ by her eyelashes;

content: 26 Because for the sake of an impure woman a man may be brought even to a cake of bread,— And a man’s wife For a precious soul may hunt!
content_old: 26 Because for the sake of an impure woman a man may be brought even to a cake of bread,— And a man’s wife For a precious soul may hunt!

content: 27 Can a man snatch up fire in his bosom, And his clothes not be burned?
content_old: 27 Can a man snatch up fire in his bosom, And his clothes not be burned?

content: 28 Or can a man walk upon hot coals, And his feet not be burned?
content_old: 28 Or can a man walk upon hot coals, And his feet not be burned?

content: 29 So he that goeth in unto his neighbour’s wife, No man shall be guiltless who toucheth her!
content_old: 29 So he that goeth in unto his neighbour’s wife, No man shall be guiltless who toucheth her!

content: 30 Men despise not a thief､ when he stealeth, To satisfy his appetite､ because he is famished;
content_old: 30 Men despise not a thief､ when he stealeth, To satisfy his appetite､ because he is famished;

content: 31 Yet if found he must pay back seven-fold, All the substance of his house must he give:
content_old: 31 Yet if found he must pay back seven-fold, All the substance of his house must he give:

content: 32 He that committeth adultery with a woman lacketh sense, A destroyer of his own life is he that doeth it;
content_old: 32 He that committeth adultery with a woman lacketh sense, A destroyer of his own life is he that doeth it;

content: 33 Smiting and shame shall he find, And his reproach shall not be wiped out;
content_old: 33 Smiting and shame shall he find, And his reproach shall not be wiped out;

content: 34 For jealousy is the rage of a man, Nor will he spare､ in the day of avenging;
content_old: 34 For jealousy is the rage of a man, Nor will he spare､ in the day of avenging;

content: 1 My son､ keep my sayings, And my commandments treasure by thee;
content_old: 1 My son､ keep my sayings, And my commandments treasure by thee;

content: 2 Keep my commandments and live, And mine instruction､ as the pupil of thine eye;
content_old: 2 Keep my commandments and live, And mine instruction､ as the pupil of thine eye;

content: 3 Bind them upon thy fingers, Write them､ on the tablet of thy heart;
content_old: 3 Bind them upon thy fingers, Write them､ on the tablet of thy heart;

content: 4 Say unto wisdom､ My sister thou! And an acquaintance call thou understanding:
content_old: 4 Say unto wisdom､ My sister thou! And an acquaintance call thou understanding:

content: 5 That thou mayest be kept､ from the woman that is a stranger, From the female unknown､ who with her speeches doth flatter.
content_old: 5 That thou mayest be kept､ from the woman that is a stranger, From the female unknown､ who with her speeches doth flatter.

content: 6 For in the window of my house, Through my lattice I looked out;
content_old: 6 For in the window of my house, Through my lattice I looked out;

content: 7 And saw among the simple ones､ Discerned among the youths､ A young man lacking sense;
content_old: 7 And saw among the simple ones､ Discerned among the youths､ A young man lacking sense;

content: 8 Passing through the street､ near her corner, And on the way to her house he sauntered along;
content_old: 8 Passing through the street､ near her corner, And on the way to her house he sauntered along;

content: 9 In the twilight､ in the evening of the day, In the midst of the night､ and the gloom;
content_old: 9 In the twilight､ in the evening of the day, In the midst of the night､ and the gloom;

content: 10 And lo! a woman came to meet him, Attired as one unchaste､ of a wily heart.
content_old: 10 And lo! a woman came to meet him, Attired as one unchaste､ of a wily heart.

content: 11 Boisterous is she､ and rebellious, In her house abide not her feet;
content_old: 11 Boisterous is she､ and rebellious, In her house abide not her feet;

content: 12 Now outside､ now in the broadways, And near every corner she lieth in wait:
content_old: 12 Now outside､ now in the broadways, And near every corner she lieth in wait:

content: 13 So she caught him､ and kissed him, And embolding her face she said to him:
content_old: 13 So she caught him､ and kissed him, And embolding her face she said to him:

content: 14 Peace-offerings are by me, To-day have I paid my vows;
content_old: 14 Peace-offerings are by me, To-day have I paid my vows;

content: 15 For this cause came I forth to meet thee, To seek diligently thy face､ and I have found thee:
content_old: 15 For this cause came I forth to meet thee, To seek diligently thy face､ and I have found thee:

content: 16 Coverlets have I spread on my couch of pleasure, Dark-hued stuffs､ of the yarn of Egypt;
content_old: 16 Coverlets have I spread on my couch of pleasure, Dark-hued stuffs､ of the yarn of Egypt;

content: 17 I have sprinkled my bed, With myrrh､ aloes､ and cinnamon:
content_old: 17 I have sprinkled my bed, With myrrh､ aloes､ and cinnamon:

content: 18 Come! let us take our fill of endearments､ until morning, Let us delight ourselves with caresses;
content_old: 18 Come! let us take our fill of endearments､ until morning, Let us delight ourselves with caresses;

content: 19 For the husband is not in his house, He hath gone on a journey afar;
content_old: 19 For the husband is not in his house, He hath gone on a journey afar;

content: 20 A bag of silver hath he taken in his hand, On the day of the full moon will he enter his house.
content_old: 20 A bag of silver hath he taken in his hand, On the day of the full moon will he enter his house.

content: 21 She turneth him aside､ with her great persuasiveness,— With the flattery of her lips she compelleth him:
content_old: 21 She turneth him aside､ with her great persuasiveness,— With the flattery of her lips she compelleth him:

content: 22 Going after her instantly As an ox､ to the slaughter he entereth, And､ as in fetters��� unto the correction of a fool.
content_old: 22 Going after her instantly As an ox､ to the slaughter he entereth, And､ as in fetters��� unto the correction of a fool.

content: 23 Until an arrow cleaveth his liver､ As a bird hasteth into a snare, And knoweth not､ that for his life it is!
content_old: 23 Until an arrow cleaveth his liver､ As a bird hasteth into a snare, And knoweth not､ that for his life it is!

content: 24 Now､ therefore ye sons､ hearken unto me, And attend､ to the sayings of my mouth;
content_old: 24 Now､ therefore ye sons､ hearken unto me, And attend､ to the sayings of my mouth;

content: 25 Let not thy heart turn aside to her ways, Do not go astray､ in her paths.
content_old: 25 Let not thy heart turn aside to her ways, Do not go astray､ in her paths.

content: 26 For many､ wounded hath she caused to fall,— Yea strong men､ slain wholly by her:
content_old: 26 For many､ wounded hath she caused to fall,— Yea strong men､ slain wholly by her:

content: 1 Doth not wisdom cry aloud? And understanding send forth her voice?
content_old: 1 Doth not wisdom cry aloud? And understanding send forth her voice?

content: 2 At the top of the high places above the way, At the place where paths meet she taketh her stand:
content_old: 2 At the top of the high places above the way, At the place where paths meet she taketh her stand:

content: 3 Beside the gates､ at the entrance of the city,— At the going in of the openings she shouteth:—
content_old: 3 Beside the gates､ at the entrance of the city,— At the going in of the openings she shouteth:—

content: 4 Unto you､ O men I call, And my voice is unto the sons of men;
content_old: 4 Unto you､ O men I call, And my voice is unto the sons of men;

content: 5 Understand､ ye simple ones､ shrewdness, And ye dullards understand sense;
content_old: 5 Understand､ ye simple ones､ shrewdness, And ye dullards understand sense;

content: 6 Hear､ for princely things will I speak, And the opening of my lips shall be of equity;
content_old: 6 Hear､ for princely things will I speak, And the opening of my lips shall be of equity;

content: 7 For faithfulness shall my mouth softly utter, But the abomination of my lips shall be lawlessness;
content_old: 7 For faithfulness shall my mouth softly utter, But the abomination of my lips shall be lawlessness;

content: 8 In righteousness shall be all the sayings of my mouth, Nothing therein shall be crafty or perverse;
content_old: 8 In righteousness shall be all the sayings of my mouth, Nothing therein shall be crafty or perverse;

content: 9 All of them shall be plain､ to them who would understand, And just､ to such as would gain knowledge.
content_old: 9 All of them shall be plain､ to them who would understand, And just､ to such as would gain knowledge.

content: 10 Receive my correction､ and not silver, And knowledge､ rather than choicest gold.
content_old: 10 Receive my correction､ and not silver, And knowledge､ rather than choicest gold.

content: 11 For better is wisdom､ than ornaments of coral, And no delightful things can equal her.
content_old: 11 For better is wisdom､ than ornaments of coral, And no delightful things can equal her.

content: 12 I､ wisdom inhabit shrewdness,— And the knowledge of sagacious things I gain.
content_old: 12 I､ wisdom inhabit shrewdness,— And the knowledge of sagacious things I gain.

content: 13 The reverence of Yahweh is to hate wickedness: Pride､ arrogance､ and the way of wickedness; And a mouth of perverse things do I hate.
content_old: 13 The reverence of Yahweh is to hate wickedness: Pride､ arrogance､ and the way of wickedness; And a mouth of perverse things do I hate.

content: 14 Mine are counsel､ and effective working, I am understanding, mine is valour:
content_old: 14 Mine are counsel､ and effective working, I am understanding, mine is valour:

content: 15 By me kings reign, And dignitaries decree righteousness;
content_old: 15 By me kings reign, And dignitaries decree righteousness;

content: 16 By me rulers govern, And nobles—all the righteous judges:
content_old: 16 By me rulers govern, And nobles—all the righteous judges:

content: 17 I love them who love me, And they who diligently seek me find me:
content_old: 17 I love them who love me, And they who diligently seek me find me:

content: 18 Riches and honour are with me, Lordly wealth, and righteousness;
content_old: 18 Riches and honour are with me, Lordly wealth, and righteousness;

content: 19 Better is my fruit､ than gold—yea fine gold, And mine increase､ than choice silver;
content_old: 19 Better is my fruit､ than gold—yea fine gold, And mine increase､ than choice silver;

content: 20 In the way of righteousness I march along, In the middle of the paths of justice:
content_old: 20 In the way of righteousness I march along, In the middle of the paths of justice:

content: 21 That I may cause them who love me to inherit substance, And their treasuries I may fill.
content_old: 21 That I may cause them who love me to inherit substance, And their treasuries I may fill.

content: 22 Yahweh had constituted me the beginning of his way, Before his works､ At the commencement of that time;
content_old: 22 Yahweh had constituted me the beginning of his way, Before his works､ At the commencement of that time;

content: 23 At the outset of the ages had I been established､ In advance of the antiquities of the earth;
content_old: 23 At the outset of the ages had I been established､ In advance of the antiquities of the earth;

content: 24 When there was no resounding deep I had been brought forth, When there were no fountains､ abounding with water;
content_old: 24 When there was no resounding deep I had been brought forth, When there were no fountains､ abounding with water;

content: 25 Ere yet the mountains had been settled, Before the hills had I been brought forth;
content_old: 25 Ere yet the mountains had been settled, Before the hills had I been brought forth;

content: 26 Or ever he had made the land and the wastes, Or the top of the dry parts of the world:
content_old: 26 Or ever he had made the land and the wastes, Or the top of the dry parts of the world:

content: 27 When he prepared the heavens there was I! When he decreed a vault upon the face of the resounding deep;
content_old: 27 When he prepared the heavens there was I! When he decreed a vault upon the face of the resounding deep;

content: 28 When he made firm the skies above, When the fountains of the resounding deep waxed strong;
content_old: 28 When he made firm the skies above, When the fountains of the resounding deep waxed strong;

content: 29 When he fixed for the sea its bound､ That the waters should not go beyond his bidding, When he decreed the foundations of the earth:—
content_old: 29 When he fixed for the sea its bound､ That the waters should not go beyond his bidding, When he decreed the foundations of the earth:—

content: 30 Then became I beside him､ a firm and sure worker, Then became I filled with delight､ day by day, Exulting before him on every occasion;
content_old: 30 Then became I beside him､ a firm and sure worker, Then became I filled with delight､ day by day, Exulting before him on every occasion;

content: 31 Exulting in the fruitful land of his earth, Yea my fulness of delight was with the sons of men.
content_old: 31 Exulting in the fruitful land of his earth, Yea my fulness of delight was with the sons of men.

content: 32 Now､ therefore ye sons､ hearken to me, For how happy are they who to my ways pay regard!
content_old: 32 Now､ therefore ye sons､ hearken to me, For how happy are they who to my ways pay regard!

content: 33 Hear ye correction､ and be wise, And do not neglect.
content_old: 33 Hear ye correction､ and be wise, And do not neglect.

content: 34 How happy the man that doth hearken to me,— Keeping guard at my doors､ day by day, Watching at the posts of my gates;
content_old: 34 How happy the man that doth hearken to me,— Keeping guard at my doors､ day by day, Watching at the posts of my gates;

content: 35 For he that findeth me findeth life, And hath obtained favour from Yahweh;
content_old: 35 For he that findeth me findeth life, And hath obtained favour from Yahweh;

content: 1 Wisdom hath builded her house, hath hewn out her seven pillars;
content_old: 1 Wisdom hath builded her house, hath hewn out her seven pillars;

content: 2 hath slaughtered her beasts､ hath mingled her wine, hath even set in order her table;
content_old: 2 hath slaughtered her beasts､ hath mingled her wine, hath even set in order her table;

content: 3 hath sent forth her maidens､ She crieth aloud Upon the tops of the heights of the city:
content_old: 3 hath sent forth her maidens､ She crieth aloud Upon the tops of the heights of the city:

content: 4 Whoso is simple､ let him turn in hither, As for him that lacketh sense she saith to him—
content_old: 4 Whoso is simple､ let him turn in hither, As for him that lacketh sense she saith to him—

content: 5 Come､ feed on my food, And drink of the wine I have mingled;
content_old: 5 Come､ feed on my food, And drink of the wine I have mingled;

content: 6 Forsake the simple ones､ and live, And advance in the way of understanding.
content_old: 6 Forsake the simple ones､ and live, And advance in the way of understanding.

content: 7 He that rebuketh a scoffer getteth to himself contempt, And he that reproveth a lawless man getteth to himself his shame.
content_old: 7 He that rebuketh a scoffer getteth to himself contempt, And he that reproveth a lawless man getteth to himself his shame.

content: 8 Do not reprove a scoffer､ lest he hate thee, Reprove a wise man､ and he will love thee.
content_old: 8 Do not reprove a scoffer､ lest he hate thee, Reprove a wise man､ and he will love thee.

content: 9 Give to a wise man､ and he will be wiser still, Inform a righteous man､ and he will increase learning.
content_old: 9 Give to a wise man､ and he will be wiser still, Inform a righteous man､ and he will increase learning.

content: 10 The beginning of wisdom is the reverence of Yahweh, And the knowledge of the Holy is understanding;
content_old: 10 The beginning of wisdom is the reverence of Yahweh, And the knowledge of the Holy is understanding;

content: 11 For by me shall be multiplied—thy days, And there be added to thee—the years of life.
content_old: 11 For by me shall be multiplied—thy days, And there be added to thee—the years of life.

content: 12 If thou art wise thou art wise for thyself, But if thou scoff alone shalt thou bear it.
content_old: 12 If thou art wise thou art wise for thyself, But if thou scoff alone shalt thou bear it.

content: 13 The woman Stupidity is boisterous, So simple that she knoweth not what she would do;
content_old: 13 The woman Stupidity is boisterous, So simple that she knoweth not what she would do;

content: 14 So she sitteth at the entrance of her house, Upon a seat､ in the heights of the city;
content_old: 14 So she sitteth at the entrance of her house, Upon a seat､ in the heights of the city;

content: 15 To invite them who pass by the way, Who are going straight on in their paths:
content_old: 15 To invite them who pass by the way, Who are going straight on in their paths:

content: 16 Whoso is simple let him turn aside hither, And as for him that lacketh sense she saith to him:
content_old: 16 Whoso is simple let him turn aside hither, And as for him that lacketh sense she saith to him:

content: 17 Stolen waters will be sweet,— And a secret meal will be pleasant;
content_old: 17 Stolen waters will be sweet,— And a secret meal will be pleasant;

content: 1 The Proverbs of Solomon: A wise son maketh a glad father, But a foolish son is the grief of his mother.
content_old: 1 The Proverbs of Solomon: A wise son maketh a glad father, But a foolish son is the grief of his mother.

content: 2 The treasures of lawlessness do not profit, But righteousness delivereth from death.
content_old: 2 The treasures of lawlessness do not profit, But righteousness delivereth from death.

content: 3 Yahweh suffereth not to famish the soul of the righteous, But the desire of the lawless he thrusteth away.
content_old: 3 Yahweh suffereth not to famish the soul of the righteous, But the desire of the lawless he thrusteth away.

content: 4 He becometh poor､ who dealeth with a slack hand, But the hand of the diligent maketh rich.
content_old: 4 He becometh poor､ who dealeth with a slack hand, But the hand of the diligent maketh rich.

content: 5 He that gathereth in summer is a prudent son, He that sleepeth long in harvest is a son causing shame.
content_old: 5 He that gathereth in summer is a prudent son, He that sleepeth long in harvest is a son causing shame.

content: 6 Blessings are for the head of the righteous man, But the mouth of the lawless covereth up wrong.
content_old: 6 Blessings are for the head of the righteous man, But the mouth of the lawless covereth up wrong.

content: 7 The memory of the righteous yieldeth blessing, But the name of the lawless dieth out.
content_old: 7 The memory of the righteous yieldeth blessing, But the name of the lawless dieth out.

content: 8 The wise in heart will accept commandments, But he that is foolish with his lips shall be thrust away.
content_old: 8 The wise in heart will accept commandments, But he that is foolish with his lips shall be thrust away.

content: 9 He that walketh uprightly may walk securely, But he that maketh crooked his ways shall be found out.
content_old: 9 He that walketh uprightly may walk securely, But he that maketh crooked his ways shall be found out.

content: 10 He that winketh with the eye causeth sorrow, And he that is foolish with his lips shall be thrust aside.
content_old: 10 He that winketh with the eye causeth sorrow, And he that is foolish with his lips shall be thrust aside.

content: 11 A well-spring of life is the mouth of the righteous, But the mouth of the lawless covereth wrong.
content_old: 11 A well-spring of life is the mouth of the righteous, But the mouth of the lawless covereth wrong.

content: 12 Hatred stirreth up strifes, But over all transgressions love throweth a covering.
content_old: 12 Hatred stirreth up strifes, But over all transgressions love throweth a covering.

content: 13 In the lips of the intelligent is found wisdom, But a rod is for the back of him that lacketh sense.
content_old: 13 In the lips of the intelligent is found wisdom, But a rod is for the back of him that lacketh sense.

content: 14 Wise men treasure up knowledge, But the mouth of the foolish is a terror near at hand.
content_old: 14 Wise men treasure up knowledge, But the mouth of the foolish is a terror near at hand.

content: 15 The substance of the rich is his strong city, The terror of the poor is their poverty.
content_old: 15 The substance of the rich is his strong city, The terror of the poor is their poverty.

content: 16 The labour of the righteous leadeth to life, The increase of the lawless to sin.
content_old: 16 The labour of the righteous leadeth to life, The increase of the lawless to sin.

content: 17 On the way to life is he that heedeth correction, But he that hateth reproof is going astray.
content_old: 17 On the way to life is he that heedeth correction, But he that hateth reproof is going astray.

content: 18 He that concealeth hatred hath false lips, And he that sendeth forth slander the same is a dullard.
content_old: 18 He that concealeth hatred hath false lips, And he that sendeth forth slander the same is a dullard.

content: 19 In the multitude of words there wanteth not transgression, But he that restraineth his lips sheweth prudence.
content_old: 19 In the multitude of words there wanteth not transgression, But he that restraineth his lips sheweth prudence.

content: 20 Choice silver is the tongue of the righteous, But the sense of the lawless is very small.
content_old: 20 Choice silver is the tongue of the righteous, But the sense of the lawless is very small.

content: 21 The lips of the righteous feed multitudes, But the foolish for lack of sense shall die.
content_old: 21 The lips of the righteous feed multitudes, But the foolish for lack of sense shall die.

content: 22 The blessing of Yahweh itself maketh rich, And he addeth no grievance therewith.
content_old: 22 The blessing of Yahweh itself maketh rich, And he addeth no grievance therewith.

content: 23 It is mere sport to a stupid man to commit lewdness, But wisdom pertaineth to a man of understanding.
content_old: 23 It is mere sport to a stupid man to commit lewdness, But wisdom pertaineth to a man of understanding.

content: 24 The dread of the lawless one the same shall overtake him, But the desire of the righteous shall be granted.
content_old: 24 The dread of the lawless one the same shall overtake him, But the desire of the righteous shall be granted.

content: 25 Like the passing away of a tempest so the lawless one is not, But the righteous hath an age-abiding foundation.
content_old: 25 Like the passing away of a tempest so the lawless one is not, But the righteous hath an age-abiding foundation.

content: 26 As vinegar to the teeth､ and as smoke to the eyes So is the sluggard､ to them who send him.
content_old: 26 As vinegar to the teeth､ and as smoke to the eyes So is the sluggard､ to them who send him.

content: 27 The reverence of Yahweh addeth days, But the years of the lawless shall be shortened.
content_old: 27 The reverence of Yahweh addeth days, But the years of the lawless shall be shortened.

content: 28 The hope of the righteous shall be gladness, But the expectation of the lawless shall vanish.
content_old: 28 The hope of the righteous shall be gladness, But the expectation of the lawless shall vanish.

content: 29 A refuge for the blameless is the path of Yahweh, But destruction awaiteth the workers of iniquity.
content_old: 29 A refuge for the blameless is the path of Yahweh, But destruction awaiteth the workers of iniquity.

content: 30 The righteous to times age-abiding shall remain unshaken, But the lawless shall not inhabit the earth.
content_old: 30 The righteous to times age-abiding shall remain unshaken, But the lawless shall not inhabit the earth.

content: 31 The mouth of the righteous beareth the fruit of wisdom, But a perverse tongue shall be cut off.
content_old: 31 The mouth of the righteous beareth the fruit of wisdom, But a perverse tongue shall be cut off.

content: 1 A deceptive balance is an abomination to Yahweh, But a full weight is his delight.
content_old: 1 A deceptive balance is an abomination to Yahweh, But a full weight is his delight.

content: 2 When pride cometh then cometh contempt, But with the modest is wisdom.
content_old: 2 When pride cometh then cometh contempt, But with the modest is wisdom.

content: 3 The integrity of the upright shall guide them, But the crookedness of the treacherous shall be their ruin.
content_old: 3 The integrity of the upright shall guide them, But the crookedness of the treacherous shall be their ruin.

content: 4 Wealth shall not profit in the day of wrath, But righteousness shall deliver from death.
content_old: 4 Wealth shall not profit in the day of wrath, But righteousness shall deliver from death.

content: 5 The righteousness of the blameless shall smooth his way, But by his own lawlessness shall the lawless one fall.
content_old: 5 The righteousness of the blameless shall smooth his way, But by his own lawlessness shall the lawless one fall.

content: 6 The righteousness of the upright shall deliver them, But by their own craving shall the treacherous be captured.
content_old: 6 The righteousness of the upright shall deliver them, But by their own craving shall the treacherous be captured.

content: 7 When the lawless man dieth his expectation perisheth, And the hope of strong men hath vanished.
content_old: 7 When the lawless man dieth his expectation perisheth, And the hope of strong men hath vanished.

content: 8 The righteous man out of distress is delivered, Then cometh a lawless man into his place.
content_old: 8 The righteous man out of distress is delivered, Then cometh a lawless man into his place.

content: 9 With the mouth a profane man destroyeth his neighbour, But through knowledge shall righteous men be delivered.
content_old: 9 With the mouth a profane man destroyeth his neighbour, But through knowledge shall righteous men be delivered.

content: 10 When it is well with the righteous the city exulteth, When the lawless perish there is a shout of triumph.
content_old: 10 When it is well with the righteous the city exulteth, When the lawless perish there is a shout of triumph.

content: 11 When the upright are blessed exalted is the city, But by the mouth of the lawless it is overthrown.
content_old: 11 When the upright are blessed exalted is the city, But by the mouth of the lawless it is overthrown.

content: 12 He that sheweth contempt for his neighbour lacketh sense, But a man of understanding observeth silence.
content_old: 12 He that sheweth contempt for his neighbour lacketh sense, But a man of understanding observeth silence.

content: 13 He that goeth about talebearing revealeth a secret, But he that is faithful in spirit concealeth a matter.
content_old: 13 He that goeth about talebearing revealeth a secret, But he that is faithful in spirit concealeth a matter.

content: 14 With no guidance a people will fall, But safety lieth in the greatness of the counsellor.
content_old: 14 With no guidance a people will fall, But safety lieth in the greatness of the counsellor.

content: 15 He that becometh surety for a stranger goeth to utter ruin, But he that hateth striking hands is secure.
content_old: 15 He that becometh surety for a stranger goeth to utter ruin, But he that hateth striking hands is secure.

content: 16 A gracious wife obtaineth honour, But the diligent shall obtain wealth.
content_old: 16 A gracious wife obtaineth honour, But the diligent shall obtain wealth.

content: 17 The man of lovingkindness dealeth well with his own soul, But the cruel man troubleth his own flesh.
content_old: 17 The man of lovingkindness dealeth well with his own soul, But the cruel man troubleth his own flesh.

content: 18 The lawless man earneth the wages of falsehood, But he that soweth righteousness hath the reward of fidelity.
content_old: 18 The lawless man earneth the wages of falsehood, But he that soweth righteousness hath the reward of fidelity.

content: 19 A righteous son turneth to life, But he that pursueth wickedness to his own death.
content_old: 19 A righteous son turneth to life, But he that pursueth wickedness to his own death.

content: 20 The abomination of Yahweh are they of perverse heart, But his delight are the men of blameless life.
content_old: 20 The abomination of Yahweh are they of perverse heart, But his delight are the men of blameless life.

content: 21 Hand to hand the wicked man shall not be held innocent, But the seed of the righteous hath been delivered.
content_old: 21 Hand to hand the wicked man shall not be held innocent, But the seed of the righteous hath been delivered.

content: 22 As a ring of gold in the snout of a swine Is a woman of beauty who hath abandoned discretion.
content_old: 22 As a ring of gold in the snout of a swine Is a woman of beauty who hath abandoned discretion.

content: 23 The desire of the righteous is only good, The expectation of the lawless is wrath.
content_old: 23 The desire of the righteous is only good, The expectation of the lawless is wrath.

content: 24 There is who scattereth､ and increaseth yet more, And who withholdeth of what is due, only to come to want.
content_old: 24 There is who scattereth､ and increaseth yet more, And who withholdeth of what is due, only to come to want.

content: 25 The liberal soul shall be enriched, And he that refresheth shall himself also be refreshed.
content_old: 25 The liberal soul shall be enriched, And he that refresheth shall himself also be refreshed.

content: 26 He that keepeth back corn the populace will curse him, But there is a blessing for the head of him that selleth.
content_old: 26 He that keepeth back corn the populace will curse him, But there is a blessing for the head of him that selleth.

content: 27 He that diligently seeketh good aimeth at favour, But he that studieth mischief it shall come on himself.
content_old: 27 He that diligently seeketh good aimeth at favour, But he that studieth mischief it shall come on himself.

content: 28 He that trusteth in his riches the same shall fall, But like the leaf shall the righteous break forth.
content_old: 28 He that trusteth in his riches the same shall fall, But like the leaf shall the righteous break forth.

content: 29 He that troubleth his own house shall inherit the wind, But a servant shall the foolish be､ to the wise in heart.
content_old: 29 He that troubleth his own house shall inherit the wind, But a servant shall the foolish be､ to the wise in heart.

content: 30 The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life, And he that rescueth souls is wise.
content_old: 30 The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life, And he that rescueth souls is wise.

content: 1 He that loveth correction loveth knowledge, But he that hateth reproof is brutish.
content_old: 1 He that loveth correction loveth knowledge, But he that hateth reproof is brutish.

content: 2 A good man obtaineth favour from Yahweh, But a man of wicked devices will he condemn.
content_old: 2 A good man obtaineth favour from Yahweh, But a man of wicked devices will he condemn.

content: 3 A son of earth shall not be established by lawlessness, But the root of the righteous shall not be disturbed.
content_old: 3 A son of earth shall not be established by lawlessness, But the root of the righteous shall not be disturbed.

content: 4 A virtuous woman is the crown of her husband, But a veritable decay in his bones is she that causeth shame.
content_old: 4 A virtuous woman is the crown of her husband, But a veritable decay in his bones is she that causeth shame.

content: 5 The plans of the righteous are just, But the counsels of the lawless are deceitful.
content_old: 5 The plans of the righteous are just, But the counsels of the lawless are deceitful.

content: 6 The words of the lawless are—of lying in wait for blood, But the mouth of the upright shall deliver them.
content_old: 6 The words of the lawless are—of lying in wait for blood, But the mouth of the upright shall deliver them.

content: 7 Overthrown are the lawless and they are not, But the house of the righteous shall stand.
content_old: 7 Overthrown are the lawless and they are not, But the house of the righteous shall stand.

content: 8 In proportion to his prudence is a man to be praised, But the perverse in heart shall be an object of contempt.
content_old: 8 In proportion to his prudence is a man to be praised, But the perverse in heart shall be an object of contempt.

content: 9 Better slighted､ and have a servant, Than to honour oneself､ and come short of bread.
content_old: 9 Better slighted､ and have a servant, Than to honour oneself､ and come short of bread.

content: 10 A righteous man regardeth the desire of his beast, But the compassions of the lawless are cruel.
content_old: 10 A righteous man regardeth the desire of his beast, But the compassions of the lawless are cruel.

content: 11 He that tilleth his land shall be filled with food, But he that runneth after worthless men lacketh sense.
content_old: 11 He that tilleth his land shall be filled with food, But he that runneth after worthless men lacketh sense.

content: 12 A lawless man craveth the prey of the wicked, But the root of the righteous is enduring.
content_old: 12 A lawless man craveth the prey of the wicked, But the root of the righteous is enduring.

content: 13 By the transgression of the lips is the wicked man ensnared, But the righteous cometh out of distress.
content_old: 13 By the transgression of the lips is the wicked man ensnared, But the righteous cometh out of distress.

content: 14 Of the fruit of a man’s mouth shall he be satisfied with good, And the dealing of the hands of a son of earth shall be paid back to him.
content_old: 14 Of the fruit of a man’s mouth shall he be satisfied with good, And the dealing of the hands of a son of earth shall be paid back to him.

content: 15 The way of the foolish is right in his own eyes, But he that hearkeneth to counsel is wise.
content_old: 15 The way of the foolish is right in his own eyes, But he that hearkeneth to counsel is wise.

content: 16 A foolish man on the same day letteth his vexation be known, But he that concealeth an affront is prudent.
content_old: 16 A foolish man on the same day letteth his vexation be known, But he that concealeth an affront is prudent.

content: 17 He that whispereth faithfulness declareth righteousness, But a false witness is a fraud.
content_old: 17 He that whispereth faithfulness declareth righteousness, But a false witness is a fraud.

content: 18 There is who babbleth､ as with thrusts of a sword, But the tongue of the wise hath healing.
content_old: 18 There is who babbleth､ as with thrusts of a sword, But the tongue of the wise hath healing.

content: 19 A lip that is faithful shall be firm to futurity, But onIy for a twinkling is the tongue that is false.
content_old: 19 A lip that is faithful shall be firm to futurity, But onIy for a twinkling is the tongue that is false.

content: 20 Deceit is in the heart of contrivers of mischief, But to the counsellors of peace shall be joy.
content_old: 20 Deceit is in the heart of contrivers of mischief, But to the counsellors of peace shall be joy.

content: 21 Unseemly to the righteous is any trouble, But the lawless are full of misfortune.
content_old: 21 Unseemly to the righteous is any trouble, But the lawless are full of misfortune.

content: 22 An abomination to Yahweh are lips that are false, But he that dealeth faithfully is his delight.
content_old: 22 An abomination to Yahweh are lips that are false, But he that dealeth faithfully is his delight.

content: 23 A prudent man concealeth knowledge, But the heart of dullards proclaimeth folly.
content_old: 23 A prudent man concealeth knowledge, But the heart of dullards proclaimeth folly.

content: 24 The hand of the diligent shall bear rule, But the indolent shall come under tribute.
content_old: 24 The hand of the diligent shall bear rule, But the indolent shall come under tribute.

content: 25 When anxiety is in the heart of a man one may bow him down, But a good word maketh him glad.
content_old: 25 When anxiety is in the heart of a man one may bow him down, But a good word maketh him glad.

content: 26 The righteous man guideth his neighbour, But the way of the lawless leadeth them astray.
content_old: 26 The righteous man guideth his neighbour, But the way of the lawless leadeth them astray.

content: 27 Indolence roasteth not his own game, But the substance of a man is precious when he is diligent.
content_old: 27 Indolence roasteth not his own game, But the substance of a man is precious when he is diligent.

content: 1 A wise son cometh of a father’s correction, But a scoffer heareth not a rebuke.
content_old: 1 A wise son cometh of a father’s correction, But a scoffer heareth not a rebuke.

content: 2 Of the fruit of his mouth shall a man eat what is good, But the soul of the treacherous shall be sated with violence.
content_old: 2 Of the fruit of his mouth shall a man eat what is good, But the soul of the treacherous shall be sated with violence.

content: 3 He that watcheth his mouth guardeth his soul, He that openeth wide his lips it shall be his ruin.
content_old: 3 He that watcheth his mouth guardeth his soul, He that openeth wide his lips it shall be his ruin.

content: 4 The sluggard desireth､ but his soul hath nothing. But the soul of the diligent shall be enriched.
content_old: 4 The sluggard desireth､ but his soul hath nothing. But the soul of the diligent shall be enriched.

content: 5 A word of falsehood the righteous man hateth, But the lawless causeth shame and disgrace.
content_old: 5 A word of falsehood the righteous man hateth, But the lawless causeth shame and disgrace.

content: 6 Righteousness guardeth the man of blameless way, But lawlessness overthroweth the sinner.
content_old: 6 Righteousness guardeth the man of blameless way, But lawlessness overthroweth the sinner.

content: 7 There is Who feigneth himself rich､ yet hath nothing at all, Who pleadeth poverty､ yet hath great substance.
content_old: 7 There is Who feigneth himself rich､ yet hath nothing at all, Who pleadeth poverty､ yet hath great substance.

content: 8 The ransom of a man’s life is his wealth, But the poor heareth not rebuke.
content_old: 8 The ransom of a man’s life is his wealth, But the poor heareth not rebuke.

content: 9 The light of the righteous rejoiceth, But the lamp of the lawless goeth out.
content_old: 9 The light of the righteous rejoiceth, But the lamp of the lawless goeth out.

content: 10 Only by pride doth one cause contention, But with the well-advised is wisdom.
content_old: 10 Only by pride doth one cause contention, But with the well-advised is wisdom.

content: 11 Wealth gotten by greed diminisheth, But he that gathereth by little increaseth.
content_old: 11 Wealth gotten by greed diminisheth, But he that gathereth by little increaseth.

content: 12 Hope deferred sickeneth the heart,— But a tree of life is desire fulfilled.
content_old: 12 Hope deferred sickeneth the heart,— But a tree of life is desire fulfilled.

content: 13 He that despiseth a matter shall get pledged thereto, But he that revereth a commandment the same shall be recompensed.
content_old: 13 He that despiseth a matter shall get pledged thereto, But he that revereth a commandment the same shall be recompensed.

content: 14 The instruction of the wise is a well-spring of life, By departing from the snares of death.
content_old: 14 The instruction of the wise is a well-spring of life, By departing from the snares of death.

content: 15 Sound discretion yieldeth favour, But the way of the treacherous is rugged.
content_old: 15 Sound discretion yieldeth favour, But the way of the treacherous is rugged.

content: 16 Every prudent man maketh use of knowledge, But a dullard spreadeth folly.
content_old: 16 Every prudent man maketh use of knowledge, But a dullard spreadeth folly.

content: 17 A lawless messenger falleth into mischief, But a faithful herald bringeth healing.
content_old: 17 A lawless messenger falleth into mischief, But a faithful herald bringeth healing.

content: 18 Poverty and contempt are for him that neglecteth correction, But he that regardeth reproof shall be honoured.
content_old: 18 Poverty and contempt are for him that neglecteth correction, But he that regardeth reproof shall be honoured.

content: 19 A desire fulfilled is sweet to the soul, But it is an abomination to the lawless to depart from evil.
content_old: 19 A desire fulfilled is sweet to the soul, But it is an abomination to the lawless to depart from evil.

content: 20 He that walketh with the wise becometh wise, But the friend of dullards becometh foolish.
content_old: 20 He that walketh with the wise becometh wise, But the friend of dullards becometh foolish.

content: 21 Evil pursueth sinners, But unto the righteous shall good be recompensed.
content_old: 21 Evil pursueth sinners, But unto the righteous shall good be recompensed.

content: 22 A good man leaveth an inheritance to children’s children, But laid up for the righteous is the wealth of the sinner.
content_old: 22 A good man leaveth an inheritance to children’s children, But laid up for the righteous is the wealth of the sinner.

content: 23 Much food is in the fallow ground of the poor, But there is that is swept away､ for want of justice.
content_old: 23 Much food is in the fallow ground of the poor, But there is that is swept away､ for want of justice.

content: 24 He that withholdeth his rod hateth his son,— But he that loveth him carefully correcteth him.
content_old: 24 He that withholdeth his rod hateth his son,— But he that loveth him carefully correcteth him.

content: 1 Every wise woman buildeth up her house, But a foolish one with her own hands would break it down.
content_old: 1 Every wise woman buildeth up her house, But a foolish one with her own hands would break it down.

content: 2 He that walketh in his uprightness is one who revereth Yahweh, But he that is crooked in his way is one who despiseth him.
content_old: 2 He that walketh in his uprightness is one who revereth Yahweh, But he that is crooked in his way is one who despiseth him.

content: 3 In the mouth of the foolish is a haughty rod, But as for the lips of the wise thou shalt give heed to them!
content_old: 3 In the mouth of the foolish is a haughty rod, But as for the lips of the wise thou shalt give heed to them!

content: 4 Without cattle the crib is clean, But much increase is in the strength of the ox.
content_old: 4 Without cattle the crib is clean, But much increase is in the strength of the ox.

content: 5 A faithful witness will not deceive, But a false witness uttereth deceitful things.
content_old: 5 A faithful witness will not deceive, But a false witness uttereth deceitful things.

content: 6 A scoffer seeketh wisdom､ and there is none, But knowledge to the discerning is easy
content_old: 6 A scoffer seeketh wisdom､ and there is none, But knowledge to the discerning is easy

content: 7 Get thee from the presence of a man that is a dullard, When thou perceivest not the lips of knowledge.
content_old: 7 Get thee from the presence of a man that is a dullard, When thou perceivest not the lips of knowledge.

content: 8 The wisdom of the prudent is to understand his way, But the folly of dullards is a fraud.
content_old: 8 The wisdom of the prudent is to understand his way, But the folly of dullards is a fraud.

content: 9 The foolish scoff at guilt, But between the upright is good pleasure.
content_old: 9 The foolish scoff at guilt, But between the upright is good pleasure.

content: 10 The heart knoweth its own bitterness, And in its joy no stranger shareth.
content_old: 10 The heart knoweth its own bitterness, And in its joy no stranger shareth.

content: 11 The house of the lawless shall be destroyed, But the tent of the upright shall flourish.
content_old: 11 The house of the lawless shall be destroyed, But the tent of the upright shall flourish.

content: 12 There is a way that enticeth a man, But at the latter end thereof are the ways of death!
content_old: 12 There is a way that enticeth a man, But at the latter end thereof are the ways of death!

content: 13 Even in laughter the heart may be in pain, And the latter end of gladness be grief.
content_old: 13 Even in laughter the heart may be in pain, And the latter end of gladness be grief.

content: 14 With his own ways shall be filled the backslider in heart, And from himself shall a good man be satisfied.
content_old: 14 With his own ways shall be filled the backslider in heart, And from himself shall a good man be satisfied.

content: 15 The simple believeth every word, But the prudent looketh well to his going.
content_old: 15 The simple believeth every word, But the prudent looketh well to his going.

content: 16 A wise man feareth､ and avoideth evil, But a dullard is haughty and confident.
content_old: 16 A wise man feareth､ and avoideth evil, But a dullard is haughty and confident.

content: 17 The impatient worketh folly, And a man of wicked devices is hated.
content_old: 17 The impatient worketh folly, And a man of wicked devices is hated.

content: 18 The simple inherit folly, But the shrewd crowneth himself with knowledge.
content_old: 18 The simple inherit folly, But the shrewd crowneth himself with knowledge.

content: 19 A based are the wicked､ before the good, And the lawless､ at the gates of the righteous.
content_old: 19 A based are the wicked､ before the good, And the lawless､ at the gates of the righteous.

content: 20 Even by his neighbour is a poor man hated, But the lovers of the rich man are many.
content_old: 20 Even by his neighbour is a poor man hated, But the lovers of the rich man are many.

content: 21 He that sheweth contempt for his neighbour sinneth, But he that sheweth favour to the afflicted how happy is he!
content_old: 21 He that sheweth contempt for his neighbour sinneth, But he that sheweth favour to the afflicted how happy is he!

content: 22 Shall they not become vagrants､ who devise evil? But lovingkindness and faithfulness be to them who devise good.
content_old: 22 Shall they not become vagrants､ who devise evil? But lovingkindness and faithfulness be to them who devise good.

content: 23 By all labour there will be abundance, But the talk of the lips tendeth only to want.
content_old: 23 By all labour there will be abundance, But the talk of the lips tendeth only to want.

content: 24 The crown of the wise is their wealth, But the folly of dullards is folly.
content_old: 24 The crown of the wise is their wealth, But the folly of dullards is folly.

content: 25 A deliverer of souls is a faithful witness, But he that uttereth falsehoods is a fraud.
content_old: 25 A deliverer of souls is a faithful witness, But he that uttereth falsehoods is a fraud.

content: 26 In the reverence of Yahweh is strong security. And his children shall have a place of refuge.
content_old: 26 In the reverence of Yahweh is strong security. And his children shall have a place of refuge.

content: 27 The reverence of Yahweh is a well-spring of life, That a man may avoid the snares of death.
content_old: 27 The reverence of Yahweh is a well-spring of life, That a man may avoid the snares of death.

content: 28 In the multitude of a people is the majesty of the king, But in the ceasing of population is the ruin of the prince.
