content_old: 28 In the multitude of a people is the majesty of the king, But in the ceasing of population is the ruin of the prince.

content: 29 One slow to anger hath great understanding, But the hasty in spirit exalteth folly.
content_old: 29 One slow to anger hath great understanding, But the hasty in spirit exalteth folly.

content: 30 The life of the whole body is a tranquil mind, But a decay of the bones is jealousy.
content_old: 30 The life of the whole body is a tranquil mind, But a decay of the bones is jealousy.

content: 31 The oppressor of the poor hath reproached his Maker, But he that sheweth favour to the needy､ is one who holdeth Him in honour.
content_old: 31 The oppressor of the poor hath reproached his Maker, But he that sheweth favour to the needy､ is one who holdeth Him in honour.

content: 32 By his own wickedness shall the lawless man be thrust down, But the righteous seeketh refuge in his integrity.
content_old: 32 By his own wickedness shall the lawless man be thrust down, But the righteous seeketh refuge in his integrity.

content: 33 In the heart of the intelligent reposeth wisdom, But in the midst of dullards it maketh itself known.
content_old: 33 In the heart of the intelligent reposeth wisdom, But in the midst of dullards it maketh itself known.

content: 34 Righteousness exalteth a nation, But a reproach to any people is sin.
content_old: 34 Righteousness exalteth a nation, But a reproach to any people is sin.

content: 1 A soft answer turneth away wrath, But a cutting word raiseth anger.
content_old: 1 A soft answer turneth away wrath, But a cutting word raiseth anger.

content: 2 The tongue of the wise adorneth knowledge,— But the mouth of dullards belcheth out folly.
content_old: 2 The tongue of the wise adorneth knowledge,— But the mouth of dullards belcheth out folly.

content: 3 In every place are the eyes of Yahweh, Observing the evil and the good.
content_old: 3 In every place are the eyes of Yahweh, Observing the evil and the good.

content: 4 Gentleness of the tongue is a tree of life, But crookedness therein a grievous wound in the spirit.
content_old: 4 Gentleness of the tongue is a tree of life, But crookedness therein a grievous wound in the spirit.

content: 5 A foolish son spurneth the correction of his father, But he that heedeth a reproof sheweth prudence.
content_old: 5 A foolish son spurneth the correction of his father, But he that heedeth a reproof sheweth prudence.

content: 6 The household of the righteous man is a great treasure, But in the increase of the lawless is disturbance.
content_old: 6 The household of the righteous man is a great treasure, But in the increase of the lawless is disturbance.

content: 7 The lips of the wise scatter abroad knowledge, But the heart of dullards is not right.
content_old: 7 The lips of the wise scatter abroad knowledge, But the heart of dullards is not right.

content: 8 The sacrifice of lawless men is an abomination to Yahweh, But the prayer of the upright is his delight.
content_old: 8 The sacrifice of lawless men is an abomination to Yahweh, But the prayer of the upright is his delight.

content: 9 An abomination to Yahweh is the way of the lawless, But the pursuer of righteousness he loveth.
content_old: 9 An abomination to Yahweh is the way of the lawless, But the pursuer of righteousness he loveth.

content: 10 There is grievous correction for him that forsaketh the right path, He that hateth rebuke shall die.
content_old: 10 There is grievous correction for him that forsaketh the right path, He that hateth rebuke shall die.

content: 11 Hades and destruction are before Yahweh, How much more then､ the hearts of the sons of men.
content_old: 11 Hades and destruction are before Yahweh, How much more then､ the hearts of the sons of men.

content: 12 A scoffer loveth not one who reproveth him, Unto the wise doth he not go.
content_old: 12 A scoffer loveth not one who reproveth him, Unto the wise doth he not go.

content: 13 A joyful heart maketh a pleasing countenance,— But in sorrow of heart is a stricken spirit.
content_old: 13 A joyful heart maketh a pleasing countenance,— But in sorrow of heart is a stricken spirit.

content: 14 The heart of the intelligent seeketh knowledge, But the mouth of dullards feedeth on folly.
content_old: 14 The heart of the intelligent seeketh knowledge, But the mouth of dullards feedeth on folly.

content: 15 All the days of the afflicted are sorrowful, But a cheerful heart is a continual banquet.
content_old: 15 All the days of the afflicted are sorrowful, But a cheerful heart is a continual banquet.

content: 16 Better is a little､ with the reverence of Yahweh, Than great treasure､ and disquietude therewith.
content_old: 16 Better is a little､ with the reverence of Yahweh, Than great treasure､ and disquietude therewith.

content: 17 Better is an allowance of herbs､ and love there, Than a fatted ox､ and hatred therewith.
content_old: 17 Better is an allowance of herbs､ and love there, Than a fatted ox､ and hatred therewith.

content: 18 A wrathful man stirreth up strife, But he that is slow to anger calmeth contention.
content_old: 18 A wrathful man stirreth up strife, But he that is slow to anger calmeth contention.

content: 19 The way of the sluggard is like a thorn hedge, But the path of the upright is a raised road.
content_old: 19 The way of the sluggard is like a thorn hedge, But the path of the upright is a raised road.

content: 20 A wise son maketh a glad father,— But a dullard despiseth his own mother.
content_old: 20 A wise son maketh a glad father,— But a dullard despiseth his own mother.

content: 21 Folly is joy to him that lacketh sense,— But a man of understanding taketh a straight course.
content_old: 21 Folly is joy to him that lacketh sense,— But a man of understanding taketh a straight course.

content: 22 Plans are frustrated､ for lack of consultation, But by the multitude of counsellors shall counsel be established.
content_old: 22 Plans are frustrated､ for lack of consultation, But by the multitude of counsellors shall counsel be established.

content: 23 A man hath joy､ in the answer of his own mouth, And a word in its season—how good!
content_old: 23 A man hath joy､ in the answer of his own mouth, And a word in its season—how good!

content: 24 The way of life is upwards to the prudent, That he may depart from hades beneath.
content_old: 24 The way of life is upwards to the prudent, That he may depart from hades beneath.

content: 25 The house of proud men will Yahweh tear down, But he will maintain the boundary of the widow.
content_old: 25 The house of proud men will Yahweh tear down, But he will maintain the boundary of the widow.

content: 26 An abomination to Yahweh are the plottings of the wicked, But with the pure are sayings of sweetness.
content_old: 26 An abomination to Yahweh are the plottings of the wicked, But with the pure are sayings of sweetness.

content: 27 He troubleth his own house who graspeth with greed, But he that hateth gifts shall live.
content_old: 27 He troubleth his own house who graspeth with greed, But he that hateth gifts shall live.

content: 28 The heart of the righteous studieth to answer, But the mouth of the lawless belcheth out mischiefs.
content_old: 28 The heart of the righteous studieth to answer, But the mouth of the lawless belcheth out mischiefs.

content: 29 Far off is Yahweh､ from the lawless, But the prayer of the righteous will he hear.
content_old: 29 Far off is Yahweh､ from the lawless, But the prayer of the righteous will he hear.

content: 30 The sparkling of bright eyes rejoiceth the heart, Good news giveth marrow to the bones.
content_old: 30 The sparkling of bright eyes rejoiceth the heart, Good news giveth marrow to the bones.

content: 31 The ear that heareth the reproof which giveth life In the midst of the wise shall remain.
content_old: 31 The ear that heareth the reproof which giveth life In the midst of the wise shall remain.

content: 32 He that declineth correction despiseth his own soul, But he that heareth reproof gaineth sense.
content_old: 32 He that declineth correction despiseth his own soul, But he that heareth reproof gaineth sense.

content: 1 To man belong the preparations of the heart, But from Yahweh cometh the answer of the tongue.
content_old: 1 To man belong the preparations of the heart, But from Yahweh cometh the answer of the tongue.

content: 2 All the ways of a man may be pure in his own eyes, But he that testeth spirits is Yahweh.
content_old: 2 All the ways of a man may be pure in his own eyes, But he that testeth spirits is Yahweh.

content: 3 Roll､ upon Yahweh､ thy doings, That thy plans may be established.
content_old: 3 Roll､ upon Yahweh､ thy doings, That thy plans may be established.

content: 4 Everything hath Yahweh made for its own purpose, Yea even the lawless one for the day of calamity.
content_old: 4 Everything hath Yahweh made for its own purpose, Yea even the lawless one for the day of calamity.

content: 5 An abomination to Yahweh is every one who is haughty in heart, Hand to hand he shall not be held innocent.
content_old: 5 An abomination to Yahweh is every one who is haughty in heart, Hand to hand he shall not be held innocent.

content: 6 By lovingkindness and fidelity shall iniquity be covered, And in the revering of Yahweh is a turning away from wrong.
content_old: 6 By lovingkindness and fidelity shall iniquity be covered, And in the revering of Yahweh is a turning away from wrong.

content: 7 When acceptable to Yahweh are the ways of a man Even his enemies doth he cause to make peace with him.
content_old: 7 When acceptable to Yahweh are the ways of a man Even his enemies doth he cause to make peace with him.

content: 8 Better a little with righteousness, Than large revenues､ without justice.
content_old: 8 Better a little with righteousness, Than large revenues､ without justice.

content: 9 A man’s heart deviseth his way, But Yahweh directeth his steps.
content_old: 9 A man’s heart deviseth his way, But Yahweh directeth his steps.

content: 10 An oracle is on the lips of a king, In giving sentence his mouth must not be unfaithful.
content_old: 10 An oracle is on the lips of a king, In giving sentence his mouth must not be unfaithful.

content: 11 The balance and scales of justice belong to Yahweh, And his handiwork are all the weights of the bag.
content_old: 11 The balance and scales of justice belong to Yahweh, And his handiwork are all the weights of the bag.

content: 12 The abomination of kings is to work lawlessness, For by righteousnesss is established a throne.
content_old: 12 The abomination of kings is to work lawlessness, For by righteousnesss is established a throne.

content: 13 The delight of kings are lips of righteousness,— And the words of uprightness he loveth.
content_old: 13 The delight of kings are lips of righteousness,— And the words of uprightness he loveth.

content: 14 The wrath of a king meaneth messengers of death, But a man who is wise will appease it.
content_old: 14 The wrath of a king meaneth messengers of death, But a man who is wise will appease it.

content: 15 In the light of a king’s countenance is life, And his good-pleasure is like the cloud of harvest-rain.
content_old: 15 In the light of a king’s countenance is life, And his good-pleasure is like the cloud of harvest-rain.

content: 16 To acquire wisdom how much better than gold! And to get hold of understanding more choice than silver!
content_old: 16 To acquire wisdom how much better than gold! And to get hold of understanding more choice than silver!

content: 17 The highway of the upright is to avoid evil, He preserveth his soul who guardeth his way.
content_old: 17 The highway of the upright is to avoid evil, He preserveth his soul who guardeth his way.

content: 18 Before grievous injury pride! And before a fall haughtiness of spirit!
content_old: 18 Before grievous injury pride! And before a fall haughtiness of spirit!

content: 19 Better is lowliness of spirit､ with the patient, Than a portion of spoil､ with the proud.
content_old: 19 Better is lowliness of spirit､ with the patient, Than a portion of spoil､ with the proud.

content: 20 He that showeth discretion concerning a matter shall find good, And he that trusteth in Yahweh how happy is he!
content_old: 20 He that showeth discretion concerning a matter shall find good, And he that trusteth in Yahweh how happy is he!

content: 21 The wise in heart shall be called intelligent, And sweetness of lips increaseth persuasiveness.
content_old: 21 The wise in heart shall be called intelligent, And sweetness of lips increaseth persuasiveness.

content: 22 A well-spring of life is discretion to its owner, But the correction of the foolish is folly.
content_old: 22 A well-spring of life is discretion to its owner, But the correction of the foolish is folly.

content: 23 The heart of the wise giveth discretion to his mouth, And upon his lips increaseth persuasiveness.
content_old: 23 The heart of the wise giveth discretion to his mouth, And upon his lips increaseth persuasiveness.

content: 24 A comb of honey are pleasant words, Sweet to the taste and healing to the bone.
content_old: 24 A comb of honey are pleasant words, Sweet to the taste and healing to the bone.

content: 25 There is a way that enticeth a man, But at the latter end thereof are the ways of death.
content_old: 25 There is a way that enticeth a man, But at the latter end thereof are the ways of death.

content: 26 The appetite of the toiler hath toiled for him, For his mouth hath urged him on.
content_old: 26 The appetite of the toiler hath toiled for him, For his mouth hath urged him on.

content: 27 An abandoned man diggeth up mischief,— And upon his lips as it were a fire is scorching.
content_old: 27 An abandoned man diggeth up mischief,— And upon his lips as it were a fire is scorching.

content: 28 A perverse man sendeth forth strife, And a tattler separateth intimate friends.
content_old: 28 A perverse man sendeth forth strife, And a tattler separateth intimate friends.

content: 29 A ruthless man enticeth his neighbour, And leadeth him in a way not good.
content_old: 29 A ruthless man enticeth his neighbour, And leadeth him in a way not good.

content: 30 Closing his eyes to devise perverse things, Biting his lips he hath plotted mischief.
content_old: 30 Closing his eyes to devise perverse things, Biting his lips he hath plotted mischief.

content: 31 A crown of adorning is a hoary head, In the way of righteousness it should be found.
content_old: 31 A crown of adorning is a hoary head, In the way of righteousness it should be found.

content: 32 Better he that is slow to anger､ than a hero, And he that ruleth his spirit､ than he that captureth a city.
content_old: 32 Better he that is slow to anger､ than a hero, And he that ruleth his spirit､ than he that captureth a city.

content: 1 Better a dry morsel､ and peace therewith, Than a house full of contentious sacrifices.
content_old: 1 Better a dry morsel､ and peace therewith, Than a house full of contentious sacrifices.

content: 2 A prudent servant shall rule over a son who causeth shame, And in the midst of brothers shall he share the inheritance.
content_old: 2 A prudent servant shall rule over a son who causeth shame, And in the midst of brothers shall he share the inheritance.

content: 3 Fining-pot for silver､ crucible for gold, But he that trieth hearts is Yahweh.
content_old: 3 Fining-pot for silver､ crucible for gold, But he that trieth hearts is Yahweh.

content: 4 Discord giveth heed to the aggrieving lip,— Falsehood giveth ear to the destroying tongue.
content_old: 4 Discord giveth heed to the aggrieving lip,— Falsehood giveth ear to the destroying tongue.

content: 5 He that mocketh the poor hath reproached his Maker, He that maketh merry at distress shall not be held innocent.
content_old: 5 He that mocketh the poor hath reproached his Maker, He that maketh merry at distress shall not be held innocent.

content: 6 The crown of old men consists of children’s children, And the adornment of children is their fathers.
content_old: 6 The crown of old men consists of children’s children, And the adornment of children is their fathers.

content: 7 Unseemly in an unworthy man is the lip of excellence, Much more in one of noble mind the lip of falsehood.
content_old: 7 Unseemly in an unworthy man is the lip of excellence, Much more in one of noble mind the lip of falsehood.

content: 8 A gift､ in the eyes of its owner､ is a stone of beauty, Whithersoever it turneth it bringeth prosperity.
content_old: 8 A gift､ in the eyes of its owner､ is a stone of beauty, Whithersoever it turneth it bringeth prosperity.

content: 9 He that hideth a transgression seeketh love, But he that repeateth a matter separateth intimate friends.
content_old: 9 He that hideth a transgression seeketh love, But he that repeateth a matter separateth intimate friends.

content: 10 A reproof sinketh more deeply into an intelligent man Than a hundred stripes､ into a dullard!
content_old: 10 A reproof sinketh more deeply into an intelligent man Than a hundred stripes､ into a dullard!

content: 11 Nothing less than rebellion doth a wicked man seek. And a relentless messenger shall be sent out against him.
content_old: 11 Nothing less than rebellion doth a wicked man seek. And a relentless messenger shall be sent out against him.

content: 12 Let a bereaved bear encounter a man, Rather than a dullard､ with his folly!
content_old: 12 Let a bereaved bear encounter a man, Rather than a dullard､ with his folly!

content: 13 He that returneth evil for good Evil shall not depart from his house.
content_old: 13 He that returneth evil for good Evil shall not depart from his house.

content: 14 A letting forth of water is the beginning of strife, Therefore before it breaketh out abandon contention.
content_old: 14 A letting forth of water is the beginning of strife, Therefore before it breaketh out abandon contention.

content: 15 He that justifieth the lawless､ and he that condemneth the righteous An abomination to Yahweh are they both.
content_old: 15 He that justifieth the lawless､ and he that condemneth the righteous An abomination to Yahweh are they both.

content: 16 Wherefore is there a price in the hand of a dullard? That he who is without sense may acquire wisdom.
content_old: 16 Wherefore is there a price in the hand of a dullard? That he who is without sense may acquire wisdom.

content: 17 At all times doth a friend love, And a brother for distress must be born.
content_old: 17 At all times doth a friend love, And a brother for distress must be born.

content: 18 A man lacking sense is one who striketh hands, Giving security､ before his neighbour.
content_old: 18 A man lacking sense is one who striketh hands, Giving security､ before his neighbour.

content: 19 A lover of transgression is one who loveth strife, He that heighteneth his door seeketh grievous harm.
content_old: 19 A lover of transgression is one who loveth strife, He that heighteneth his door seeketh grievous harm.

content: 20 The crooked in heart shall not find good, And he that is perverse with his tongue shall fall into wickedness.
content_old: 20 The crooked in heart shall not find good, And he that is perverse with his tongue shall fall into wickedness.

content: 21 He that begetteth a dullard it is to his own grief, Neither can the father of the base rejoice.
content_old: 21 He that begetteth a dullard it is to his own grief, Neither can the father of the base rejoice.

content: 22 A joyful heart worketh an excellent cure,— But a stricken spirit drieth up the bone.
content_old: 22 A joyful heart worketh an excellent cure,— But a stricken spirit drieth up the bone.

content: 23 A bribe out of his bosom doth a lawless man take, To pervert the ways of justice.
content_old: 23 A bribe out of his bosom doth a lawless man take, To pervert the ways of justice.

content: 24 Before the face of the discerning is wisdom, But the eyes of a dullard are in the ends of the earth.
content_old: 24 Before the face of the discerning is wisdom, But the eyes of a dullard are in the ends of the earth.

content: 25 A vexation to his father is the son that is a dullard, And a bitterness､ to her that bare him.
content_old: 25 A vexation to his father is the son that is a dullard, And a bitterness､ to her that bare him.

content: 26 Surely to chastise the righteous is not good, To smite the noble-minded for equity.
content_old: 26 Surely to chastise the righteous is not good, To smite the noble-minded for equity.

content: 27 Sparing of his words is one who valueth knowledge, And of a thoughtful spirit is a man of intelligence.
content_old: 27 Sparing of his words is one who valueth knowledge, And of a thoughtful spirit is a man of intelligence.

content: 1 A man seeketh for satisfaction going his own way, Through all safe counsel he breaketh.
content_old: 1 A man seeketh for satisfaction going his own way, Through all safe counsel he breaketh.

content: 2 A dullard delighteth not in understanding, In nothing save the exposing of his own heart.
content_old: 2 A dullard delighteth not in understanding, In nothing save the exposing of his own heart.

content: 3 When the lawless man cometh in then cometh also contempt, And with shame reproach.
content_old: 3 When the lawless man cometh in then cometh also contempt, And with shame reproach.

content: 4 Deep waters are the words of a man’s mouth,— A bubbling brook the well-spring of wisdom.
content_old: 4 Deep waters are the words of a man’s mouth,— A bubbling brook the well-spring of wisdom.

content: 5 To prefer a lawless man is not good, Thrusting away the righteous､ in judgment.
content_old: 5 To prefer a lawless man is not good, Thrusting away the righteous､ in judgment.

content: 6 The lips of a dullard enter into contention, And his mouth for blows crieth out.
content_old: 6 The lips of a dullard enter into contention, And his mouth for blows crieth out.

content: 7 The mouth of a dullard is his ruin, And his lips are a snare to his soul.
content_old: 7 The mouth of a dullard is his ruin, And his lips are a snare to his soul.

content: 8 The words of a tattler are dainties, They therefore go down into the chambers of the inner man.
content_old: 8 The words of a tattler are dainties, They therefore go down into the chambers of the inner man.

content: 9 Surely he that is slothful in his work Brother is he to a master at laying waste.
content_old: 9 Surely he that is slothful in his work Brother is he to a master at laying waste.

content: 10 A tower of strength is the Name of Yahweh, Thereinto runneth the righteous､ and is safe.
content_old: 10 A tower of strength is the Name of Yahweh, Thereinto runneth the righteous､ and is safe.

content: 11 The substance of a rich man is his strong city, And like a high wall､ in his imagination.
content_old: 11 The substance of a rich man is his strong city, And like a high wall､ in his imagination.

content: 12 Before grievous injury a man’s heart is haughty, And before honour is humility.
content_old: 12 Before grievous injury a man’s heart is haughty, And before honour is humility.

content: 13 He that answereth before he heareth A folly it is to him､ and a reproach.
content_old: 13 He that answereth before he heareth A folly it is to him､ and a reproach.

content: 14 The spirit of a man sustaineth his sickness, But a dejected spirit who can bear it?
content_old: 14 The spirit of a man sustaineth his sickness, But a dejected spirit who can bear it?

content: 15 The heart of the intelligent acquireth knowledge, Yea the ear of the wise seeketh knowledge.
content_old: 15 The heart of the intelligent acquireth knowledge, Yea the ear of the wise seeketh knowledge.

content: 16 The gift of a man maketh room for him. And before great men setteth him down.
content_old: 16 The gift of a man maketh room for him. And before great men setteth him down.

content: 17 Righteous is he that is first in his own cause, Then cometh his neighbour､ and thoroughly searcheth him.
content_old: 17 Righteous is he that is first in his own cause, Then cometh his neighbour､ and thoroughly searcheth him.

content: 18 The lot causeth contentions to cease, And the mighty it parteth.
content_old: 18 The lot causeth contentions to cease, And the mighty it parteth.

content: 19 A brother estranged is worse than a strong city,— And contentions are as the bar of a citadel.
content_old: 19 A brother estranged is worse than a strong city,— And contentions are as the bar of a citadel.

content: 20 Of the fruit of a man’s mouth shall his inmost mind be satisfied, With the product of his lips shall he be satisfied.
content_old: 20 Of the fruit of a man’s mouth shall his inmost mind be satisfied, With the product of his lips shall he be satisfied.

content: 21 Death and life are in the power of the tongue, And its friends shall eat its fruits.
content_old: 21 Death and life are in the power of the tongue, And its friends shall eat its fruits.

content: 22 Who hath found a wife hath found a blessing, And hath obtained favour from Yahweh.
content_old: 22 Who hath found a wife hath found a blessing, And hath obtained favour from Yahweh.

content: 23 Supplications doth the poor man utter, But the rich answereth fiercely.
content_old: 23 Supplications doth the poor man utter, But the rich answereth fiercely.

content: 1 Better is a poor man､ walking in his integrity, Than one of perverse lips､ and he a dullard.
content_old: 1 Better is a poor man､ walking in his integrity, Than one of perverse lips､ and he a dullard.

content: 2 Surely for the soul to be without knowledge is not good, And he that hasteth with his feet strayeth.
content_old: 2 Surely for the soul to be without knowledge is not good, And he that hasteth with his feet strayeth.

content: 3 The folly of a man subverteth his way, And against Yahweh his heart is angry.
content_old: 3 The folly of a man subverteth his way, And against Yahweh his heart is angry.

content: 4 Wealth addeth many friends, But the poor man from his own friend is parted.
content_old: 4 Wealth addeth many friends, But the poor man from his own friend is parted.

content: 5 A false witness shall not be held innocent, And he that uttereth lies shall not escape.
content_old: 5 A false witness shall not be held innocent, And he that uttereth lies shall not escape.

content: 6 Many will entreat the favour of a noble, And every one is a friend to a man abounding in gifts.
content_old: 6 Many will entreat the favour of a noble, And every one is a friend to a man abounding in gifts.

content: 7 All the brethren of a poor man hate him､ How much more have his friends gone far from him, He may hunt up promises—there are none.
content_old: 7 All the brethren of a poor man hate him､ How much more have his friends gone far from him, He may hunt up promises—there are none.

content: 8 He that acquireth sense loveth his own soul, He that guardeth understanding shall find blessing.
content_old: 8 He that acquireth sense loveth his own soul, He that guardeth understanding shall find blessing.

content: 9 A false witness shall not be held innocent, And he that uttereth lies shall perish.
content_old: 9 A false witness shall not be held innocent, And he that uttereth lies shall perish.

content: 10 Unseemly for a dullard is delicate living, How much more for a servant to bear rule over princes.
content_old: 10 Unseemly for a dullard is delicate living, How much more for a servant to bear rule over princes.

content: 11 The discretion of a man deferreth his anger, And his adorning is to pass over transgression.
content_old: 11 The discretion of a man deferreth his anger, And his adorning is to pass over transgression.

content: 12 The growl as of a young lion is the rage of a king, But like dew upon the grass is his good pleasure.
content_old: 12 The growl as of a young lion is the rage of a king, But like dew upon the grass is his good pleasure.

content: 13 Engulfing ruin to his father is a son that is a dullard,— And a continuous dripping are the contentions of a wife.
content_old: 13 Engulfing ruin to his father is a son that is a dullard,— And a continuous dripping are the contentions of a wife.

content: 14 House and substance are an inheritance from one’s fathers, But from Yahweh cometh a wife who is prudent.
content_old: 14 House and substance are an inheritance from one’s fathers, But from Yahweh cometh a wife who is prudent.

content: 15 Sloth falleth into a deep sleep, And a soul that is indolent shall famish.
content_old: 15 Sloth falleth into a deep sleep, And a soul that is indolent shall famish.

content: 16 One who guardeth the commandment guardeth his life, He that is reckless in his ways shall die.
content_old: 16 One who guardeth the commandment guardeth his life, He that is reckless in his ways shall die.

content: 17 A lender to Yahweh is one who sheweth favour to the poor, And his good deed He will pay him back.
content_old: 17 A lender to Yahweh is one who sheweth favour to the poor, And his good deed He will pay him back.

content: 18 Correct thy son､ because there is hope, Yet not so as to slay him let thy passion be excited.
content_old: 18 Correct thy son､ because there is hope, Yet not so as to slay him let thy passion be excited.

content: 19 A man in a rage taketh away the penalty,— Nevertheless if thou let him go free the more stripes must thou add.
content_old: 19 A man in a rage taketh away the penalty,— Nevertheless if thou let him go free the more stripes must thou add.

content: 20 Hear counsel､ receive correction, that thou mayest be wise in thine after-life.
content_old: 20 Hear counsel､ receive correction, that thou mayest be wise in thine after-life.

content: 21 Many are the devices in a man’s heart, But the counsel of Yahweh that shall stand.
content_old: 21 Many are the devices in a man’s heart, But the counsel of Yahweh that shall stand.

content: 22 The charm of a man is his lovingkindness,— And better a poor man､ than one who deceiveth.
content_old: 22 The charm of a man is his lovingkindness,— And better a poor man､ than one who deceiveth.

content: 23 The reverence of Yahweh leadeth to life, Satisfied then､ let a man remain—let him not be visited by calamity.
content_old: 23 The reverence of Yahweh leadeth to life, Satisfied then､ let a man remain—let him not be visited by calamity.

content: 24 A sluggard burieth his hand in the dish, Even unto his own mouth will he not bring it back.
content_old: 24 A sluggard burieth his hand in the dish, Even unto his own mouth will he not bring it back.

content: 25 The scoffer thou shalt smite､ and the simple will beware, But correct a man of intelligence—he will understand teaching.
content_old: 25 The scoffer thou shalt smite､ and the simple will beware, But correct a man of intelligence—he will understand teaching.

content: 26 He that ruineth his father､ and chaseth away his mother Is a son causing shame and reproach.
content_old: 26 He that ruineth his father､ and chaseth away his mother Is a son causing shame and reproach.

content: 27 Cease､ my son､ to hear instruction that would cause thee to wander from the sayings of knowledge.
content_old: 27 Cease､ my son､ to hear instruction that would cause thee to wander from the sayings of knowledge.

content: 28 An abandoned witness scorneth justice, And the mouth of lawless men swalloweth iniquity.
content_old: 28 An abandoned witness scorneth justice, And the mouth of lawless men swalloweth iniquity.

content: 1 Wine is a scoffer､ and strong drink a brawler, Every one therefore who erreth therein is unwise.
content_old: 1 Wine is a scoffer､ and strong drink a brawler, Every one therefore who erreth therein is unwise.

content: 2 The growl as of a young lion is the dread inspired by a king, He that provoketh him endangereth his own life.
content_old: 2 The growl as of a young lion is the dread inspired by a king, He that provoketh him endangereth his own life.

content: 3 Honour hath the man who sitteth away from strife, But any fool may break through.
content_old: 3 Honour hath the man who sitteth away from strife, But any fool may break through.

content: 4 By reason of the autumn a sluggard will not plough, Therefore shall he beg in harvest, and there be nothing.
content_old: 4 By reason of the autumn a sluggard will not plough, Therefore shall he beg in harvest, and there be nothing.

content: 5 Deep water is counsel in a man’s heart, But a man of understanding will draw it out.
content_old: 5 Deep water is counsel in a man’s heart, But a man of understanding will draw it out.

content: 6 A kind man one may call a great man,— But a faithful man who can find?
content_old: 6 A kind man one may call a great man,— But a faithful man who can find?

content: 7 As for a righteous man walking in his integrity How happy are his children after him!
content_old: 7 As for a righteous man walking in his integrity How happy are his children after him!

content: 8 A king sitting on the throne of judgment Scattereth､ with his eyes､ all wrong.
content_old: 8 A king sitting on the throne of judgment Scattereth､ with his eyes､ all wrong.

content: 9 Who can say､ I have cleansed my heart, I am pure from my sin?
content_old: 9 Who can say､ I have cleansed my heart, I am pure from my sin?

content: 10 Divers weights､ and divers measures An abomination to Yahweh are they both.
content_old: 10 Divers weights､ and divers measures An abomination to Yahweh are they both.

content: 11 Even by his doings doth a youth make himself known, Whether pure and upright be his work.
content_old: 11 Even by his doings doth a youth make himself known, Whether pure and upright be his work.

content: 12 The hearing ear､ and the seeing eye Yahweh hath made them both.
content_old: 12 The hearing ear､ and the seeing eye Yahweh hath made them both.

content: 13 Do not love sleep､ lest thou come to poverty, Open thine eyes､ be satisfied with bread.
content_old: 13 Do not love sleep､ lest thou come to poverty, Open thine eyes､ be satisfied with bread.

content: 14 Bad! bad! saith the buyer, But going his way then he boasteth.
content_old: 14 Bad! bad! saith the buyer, But going his way then he boasteth.

content: 15 There are gold､ and an abundance of corals, But precious jewels are the lips of knowledge.
content_old: 15 There are gold､ and an abundance of corals, But precious jewels are the lips of knowledge.

content: 16 Take his garment who is pledge for a stranger,— Then for a woman unknown accept him as surety.
content_old: 16 Take his garment who is pledge for a stranger,— Then for a woman unknown accept him as surety.

content: 17 Sweet to a man may be the bread of falsehood, But afterward shall his mouth be filled with gravel.
content_old: 17 Sweet to a man may be the bread of falsehood, But afterward shall his mouth be filled with gravel.

content: 18 Plans—by counsel shalt thou establish, And with concerted measures make thou war.
content_old: 18 Plans—by counsel shalt thou establish, And with concerted measures make thou war.

content: 19 A revealer of secrets is one who goeth about talebearing, Therefore with him who openeth his lips shalt thou not have fellowship.
content_old: 19 A revealer of secrets is one who goeth about talebearing, Therefore with him who openeth his lips shalt thou not have fellowship.

content: 20 Whoso revileth his father or his mother His lamp shall be put out in deep darkness.
content_old: 20 Whoso revileth his father or his mother His lamp shall be put out in deep darkness.

content: 21 An inheritance hastily gotten at the beginning The latter end thereof shall not bring blessing.
content_old: 21 An inheritance hastily gotten at the beginning The latter end thereof shall not bring blessing.

content: 22 Do not say､ I will requite wrong! Wait thou for Yahweh that he may save thee.
content_old: 22 Do not say､ I will requite wrong! Wait thou for Yahweh that he may save thee.

content: 23 An abomination to Yahweh are divers weights, And deceptive balances are not good.
content_old: 23 An abomination to Yahweh are divers weights, And deceptive balances are not good.

content: 24 From Yahweh are a man’s steps, A son of earth then—how can he discern his way?
content_old: 24 From Yahweh are a man’s steps, A son of earth then—how can he discern his way?

content: 25 It is a snare to a man that he should rashly cry Holy! And after making vows to reflect!
content_old: 25 It is a snare to a man that he should rashly cry Holy! And after making vows to reflect!

content: 26 A wise king winnoweth out the lawless, When he hath turned over them the wheel.
content_old: 26 A wise king winnoweth out the lawless, When he hath turned over them the wheel.

content: 27 The lamp of Yahweh is the spirit of a son of earth, Searching all the chambers of the inner man.
content_old: 27 The lamp of Yahweh is the spirit of a son of earth, Searching all the chambers of the inner man.

content: 28 Lovingkindness and faithfulness will guard a king,— Therefore should he support､ with lovingkindness､ his throne.
content_old: 28 Lovingkindness and faithfulness will guard a king,— Therefore should he support､ with lovingkindness､ his throne.

content: 29 The beauty of young men is their strength, And the ornament of old men a hoary head.
content_old: 29 The beauty of young men is their strength, And the ornament of old men a hoary head.

content: 1 Like channels of water is the heart of a king､ in the hand of Yahweh,— Whithersoever he will he turneth it.
content_old: 1 Like channels of water is the heart of a king､ in the hand of Yahweh,— Whithersoever he will he turneth it.

content: 2 Every way of a man may be right in his own eyes, But he that testeth hearts is Yahweh.
content_old: 2 Every way of a man may be right in his own eyes, But he that testeth hearts is Yahweh.

content: 3 To do righteousness and justice Is more choice to Yahweh than sacrifice.
content_old: 3 To do righteousness and justice Is more choice to Yahweh than sacrifice.

content: 4 Loftiness of eyes､ and ambition of heart— The lamp of the lawless are sin.
content_old: 4 Loftiness of eyes､ and ambition of heart— The lamp of the lawless are sin.

content: 5 The plans of the diligent tend only to abundance, But of every one that is urgent only to want.
content_old: 5 The plans of the diligent tend only to abundance, But of every one that is urgent only to want.

content: 6 The gaining of treasures with a tongue of falsehood Is a vapour driven away､ they who seek them seek death.
content_old: 6 The gaining of treasures with a tongue of falsehood Is a vapour driven away､ they who seek them seek death.

content: 7 The violence of the lawless shall drag them away,— Because they have refused to do justice.
content_old: 7 The violence of the lawless shall drag them away,— Because they have refused to do justice.

content: 8 Crooked is the way of a guilty man, But as for the pure straight is his dealing.
content_old: 8 Crooked is the way of a guilty man, But as for the pure straight is his dealing.

content: 9 Better to dwell on the corner of the roof Than a quarrelsome wife, and a house in common.
content_old: 9 Better to dwell on the corner of the roof Than a quarrelsome wife, and a house in common.

content: 10 The soul of the lawless man craveth mischief, His own friend findeth no favour in his eyes.
content_old: 10 The soul of the lawless man craveth mischief, His own friend findeth no favour in his eyes.

content: 11 When the scoffer is punished the simple becometh wise, When the wise is instructed he receiveth knowledge.
content_old: 11 When the scoffer is punished the simple becometh wise, When the wise is instructed he receiveth knowledge.

content: 12 The Righteous One observeth the house of the lawless,— He is ready to cast down lawless men into misfortune.
content_old: 12 The Righteous One observeth the house of the lawless,— He is ready to cast down lawless men into misfortune.

content: 13 He that shutteth his ear from the cry of the poor Even he shall call､ and not be answered.
content_old: 13 He that shutteth his ear from the cry of the poor Even he shall call､ and not be answered.

content: 14 A gift in secret quencheth anger, And a present in the bosom mighty wrath.
content_old: 14 A gift in secret quencheth anger, And a present in the bosom mighty wrath.

content: 15 It is a joy､ to a righteous man to do justice, But dismay to the workers of iniquity.
content_old: 15 It is a joy､ to a righteous man to do justice, But dismay to the workers of iniquity.

content: 16 The man who wandereth from the way of discretion In the gathered host of the shades shall settle down.
content_old: 16 The man who wandereth from the way of discretion In the gathered host of the shades shall settle down.

content: 17 A needy man shall he be that loveth merriment, The lover of wine and oil shall not become rich.
content_old: 17 A needy man shall he be that loveth merriment, The lover of wine and oil shall not become rich.

content: 18 A ransom for the righteous is the lawless, And instead of upright men the traitor.
content_old: 18 A ransom for the righteous is the lawless, And instead of upright men the traitor.

content: 19 Better to dwell in a desert land Than with a woman､ quarrelsome and provoking.
content_old: 19 Better to dwell in a desert land Than with a woman､ quarrelsome and provoking.

content: 20 Desirable treasure and oil are in the home of the wise, But a man who is a dullard will destroy it.
content_old: 20 Desirable treasure and oil are in the home of the wise, But a man who is a dullard will destroy it.

content: 21 He that pursueth righteousness and lovingkindness Shall find life､ righteousness and honour.
content_old: 21 He that pursueth righteousness and lovingkindness Shall find life､ righteousness and honour.

content: 22 A city of heroes doth a wise man scale, And bringeth down the strength of its confidence.
content_old: 22 A city of heroes doth a wise man scale, And bringeth down the strength of its confidence.

content: 23 He that keepeth his mouth and his tongue Keepeth､ out of distresses､ his soul.
content_old: 23 He that keepeth his mouth and his tongue Keepeth､ out of distresses､ his soul.

content: 24 A haughty insolent one—Scoffer is his name Is he that acteth in a transport of pride.
content_old: 24 A haughty insolent one—Scoffer is his name Is he that acteth in a transport of pride.

content: 25 The craving of the sluggard killeth him, For his hands have refused to work.
content_old: 25 The craving of the sluggard killeth him, For his hands have refused to work.

content: 26 All the day he greatly craveth, Whereas the righteous giveth､ and doth not spare.
content_old: 26 All the day he greatly craveth, Whereas the righteous giveth､ and doth not spare.

content: 27 The sacrifice of the lawless is an abomination, How much more､ when with wickedness he bringeth it in!
content_old: 27 The sacrifice of the lawless is an abomination, How much more､ when with wickedness he bringeth it in!

content: 28 A false witness shall perish, But the man who hearkeneth with abiding effect shall speak.
content_old: 28 A false witness shall perish, But the man who hearkeneth with abiding effect shall speak.

content: 29 A lawless man emboldeneth his face, But as for the upright he directeth his ways.
content_old: 29 A lawless man emboldeneth his face, But as for the upright he directeth his ways.

content: 30 There is no wisdom､ nor understanding, Nor counsel､ to confront Yahweh.
content_old: 30 There is no wisdom､ nor understanding, Nor counsel､ to confront Yahweh.

content: 1 More choice is a name､ than great riches, Beyond silver and gold is pleasant grace.
content_old: 1 More choice is a name､ than great riches, Beyond silver and gold is pleasant grace.

content: 2 The rich and the poor meet together, The maker of them all is Yahweh.
content_old: 2 The rich and the poor meet together, The maker of them all is Yahweh.

content: 3 A prudent man seeth calamity､ and hideth himself, But the simple pass on､ and suffer,
content_old: 3 A prudent man seeth calamity､ and hideth himself, But the simple pass on､ and suffer,

content: 4 The reward of humility is the reverence of Yahweh, Riches､ and honour､ and life.
content_old: 4 The reward of humility is the reverence of Yahweh, Riches､ and honour､ and life.

content: 5 Thorns and snares are in the way of the perverse,— He that guardeth his soul shall be far from them.
content_old: 5 Thorns and snares are in the way of the perverse,— He that guardeth his soul shall be far from them.

content: 6 Train up a youth､ in the direction of his duty, Even when he becometh old he will not depart from it.
content_old: 6 Train up a youth､ in the direction of his duty, Even when he becometh old he will not depart from it.

content: 7 The rich over the poor beareth rule,— And slave is the borrower to the lender.
content_old: 7 The rich over the poor beareth rule,— And slave is the borrower to the lender.

content: 8 He that soweth perversity shall reap trouble, And the rod of his wrath shall be ready.
content_old: 8 He that soweth perversity shall reap trouble, And the rod of his wrath shall be ready.

content: 9 A benevolent eye the same shall be blessed,— Because he hath given of his bread to the poor.
content_old: 9 A benevolent eye the same shall be blessed,— Because he hath given of his bread to the poor.

content: 10 Drive away the scoffer､ that strife may depart, And quarrel､ and contempt may cease.
content_old: 10 Drive away the scoffer､ that strife may depart, And quarrel､ and contempt may cease.

content: 11 Yahweh loveth the pure in heart, Gracious are his lips､ his friend is the king!
content_old: 11 Yahweh loveth the pure in heart, Gracious are his lips､ his friend is the king!

content: 12 The eyes of Yahweh watch over knowledge, Therefore hath he overturned the words of the treacherous.
content_old: 12 The eyes of Yahweh watch over knowledge, Therefore hath he overturned the words of the treacherous.

content: 13 Saith the sluggard､ A lion outside! Amidst the broadways shall I be slain.
content_old: 13 Saith the sluggard､ A lion outside! Amidst the broadways shall I be slain.

content: 14 A deep chasm is the mouth of strange women, He with whom Yahweh is indignant falleth there.
content_old: 14 A deep chasm is the mouth of strange women, He with whom Yahweh is indignant falleth there.

content: 15 Foolishness is bound up in the heart of a youth, The rod of correction shall drive it far from him.
content_old: 15 Foolishness is bound up in the heart of a youth, The rod of correction shall drive it far from him.

content: 16 He that oppresseth the poor､ to make increase for himself, Giving to the rich shall surely come to want.
content_old: 16 He that oppresseth the poor､ to make increase for himself, Giving to the rich shall surely come to want.

content: 17 Incline thine ear and hear the words of wise men, Then thy heart wilt thou apply to my teaching;
content_old: 17 Incline thine ear and hear the words of wise men, Then thy heart wilt thou apply to my teaching;

content: 18 For sweet shall they be､ when thou shalt keep them in thine inmost mind, They shall fit well together､ upon thy lips.
content_old: 18 For sweet shall they be､ when thou shalt keep them in thine inmost mind, They shall fit well together､ upon thy lips.

content: 19 That in Yahweh may be thy trust I have made them known to thee to-day even to thee.
content_old: 19 That in Yahweh may be thy trust I have made them known to thee to-day even to thee.

content: 20 Have I not written for thee noble things, With counsels and knowledge:
content_old: 20 Have I not written for thee noble things, With counsels and knowledge:

content: 21 To cause thee to know the meaning of faithful sayings, That thou mayest give back faithful sayings to them who ask thee.
content_old: 21 To cause thee to know the meaning of faithful sayings, That thou mayest give back faithful sayings to them who ask thee.

content: 22 Do not rob the poor､ because he is poor, Neither crush thou the oppressed in the gate;
content_old: 22 Do not rob the poor､ because he is poor, Neither crush thou the oppressed in the gate;

content: 23 For Yahweh will plead their cause, And will despoil their despoilers of life.
content_old: 23 For Yahweh will plead their cause, And will despoil their despoilers of life.

content: 24 Do not have friendship with one given to anger､ And with a wrathful man shalt thou not enter in:
content_old: 24 Do not have friendship with one given to anger､ And with a wrathful man shalt thou not enter in:

content: 25 Lest thou learn his ways, And take a snare to thy soul.
content_old: 25 Lest thou learn his ways, And take a snare to thy soul.

content: 26 Be not of them who strike hands, Of them who are sureties for debts:
content_old: 26 Be not of them who strike hands, Of them who are sureties for debts:

content: 27 If thou hast nothing to pay Why should one take away thy bed from under thee?
content_old: 27 If thou hast nothing to pay Why should one take away thy bed from under thee?

content: 28 Do not move back the ancient boundary, Which thy fathers made.
content_old: 28 Do not move back the ancient boundary, Which thy fathers made.

content: 1 When thou sittest to eat with a ruler Thou shalt consider well what is before thee;
content_old: 1 When thou sittest to eat with a ruler Thou shalt consider well what is before thee;

content: 2 And shalt put a knife to thy throat, If of great appetite thou art:
content_old: 2 And shalt put a knife to thy throat, If of great appetite thou art:

content: 3 Do not crave his dainties, For the same are deceitful food.
content_old: 3 Do not crave his dainties, For the same are deceitful food.

content: 4 Do not toil to get wealth, Of thine own understanding forbear:
content_old: 4 Do not toil to get wealth, Of thine own understanding forbear:

content: 5 Wilt thou let thine eye fly thereupon､ when it is nothing? For it will surely make itself wings, Like an eagle will it wing its way across the heavens.
content_old: 5 Wilt thou let thine eye fly thereupon､ when it is nothing? For it will surely make itself wings, Like an eagle will it wing its way across the heavens.

content: 6 Do not eat the food of him that hath a begrudging eye, Neither crave thou his dainties;
content_old: 6 Do not eat the food of him that hath a begrudging eye, Neither crave thou his dainties;

content: 7 For just as he hath thought in his own mind so he is: Eat and drink! he may say to thee, But his heart is not with thee.
content_old: 7 For just as he hath thought in his own mind so he is: Eat and drink! he may say to thee, But his heart is not with thee.

content: 8 As for thy morsel thou hast eaten thou shalt vomit it, So shalt thou waste thy things so sweet.
content_old: 8 As for thy morsel thou hast eaten thou shalt vomit it, So shalt thou waste thy things so sweet.

content: 9 In the ears of a dullard do not speak, For he will despise the good sense of thy words.
content_old: 9 In the ears of a dullard do not speak, For he will despise the good sense of thy words.

content: 10 Do not move back the ancient boundary, And into the fields of the fatherless do not enter;
content_old: 10 Do not move back the ancient boundary, And into the fields of the fatherless do not enter;

content: 11 For their near of kin is strong, He will plead their cause with thee.
content_old: 11 For their near of kin is strong, He will plead their cause with thee.

content: 12 Bring､ to correction､ thy heart, And thine ears､ to the sayings of knowledge.
content_old: 12 Bring､ to correction､ thy heart, And thine ears､ to the sayings of knowledge.

content: 13 Do not withhold､ from a child､ correction, When thou smitest him with the rod he shall not die:
content_old: 13 Do not withhold､ from a child､ correction, When thou smitest him with the rod he shall not die:

content: 14 Thou with the rod shalt smite him, And his soul from hades shalt thou deliver.
content_old: 14 Thou with the rod shalt smite him, And his soul from hades shalt thou deliver.

content: 15 My son! if thy heart be wise My heart shall rejoice even mine.
content_old: 15 My son! if thy heart be wise My heart shall rejoice even mine.

content: 16 So shall my reins exult, When thy lips speak the things that are right.
content_old: 16 So shall my reins exult, When thy lips speak the things that are right.

content: 17 Let not thy heart be envious of sinners, Only of the reverence of Yahweh､ all day long;
content_old: 17 Let not thy heart be envious of sinners, Only of the reverence of Yahweh､ all day long;

content: 18 For surely there is a future, And thine expectation shall not be cut off.
content_old: 18 For surely there is a future, And thine expectation shall not be cut off.

content: 19 Hear thou my son､ and be wise, And lead forward､ in duty､ thy heart.
content_old: 19 Hear thou my son､ and be wise, And lead forward､ in duty､ thy heart.

content: 20 Do not be among them who tipple with wine,— Among them who are gluttons;
content_old: 20 Do not be among them who tipple with wine,— Among them who are gluttons;

content: 21 For the tippler and the glutton shall come to poverty, And rags shall Slumber put on!
content_old: 21 For the tippler and the glutton shall come to poverty, And rags shall Slumber put on!

content: 22 Hearken to thy father here､ who begat thee, And despise not when she is old thy mother.
content_old: 22 Hearken to thy father here､ who begat thee, And despise not when she is old thy mother.

content: 23 Truth buy thou､ but do not sell, Wisdom､ and correction､ and understanding.
content_old: 23 Truth buy thou､ but do not sell, Wisdom､ and correction､ and understanding.

content: 24 Greatly shall exult the father of a righteous man, And he that begetteth a wise son shall rejoice in him:
content_old: 24 Greatly shall exult the father of a righteous man, And he that begetteth a wise son shall rejoice in him:

content: 25 Rejoice shall thy father and thy mother, Yea she shall exult who bare thee.
content_old: 25 Rejoice shall thy father and thy mother, Yea she shall exult who bare thee.

content: 26 Oh give､ my son､ thy mind unto me, And let thine eyes observe my ways;
content_old: 26 Oh give､ my son､ thy mind unto me, And let thine eyes observe my ways;

content: 27 For a deep chasm is the unchaste woman, And a narrow pit the female unknown;
content_old: 27 For a deep chasm is the unchaste woman, And a narrow pit the female unknown;

content: 28 Yea she as for prey lieth in wait, And the treacherous among mankind she causeth to abound.
content_old: 28 Yea she as for prey lieth in wait, And the treacherous among mankind she causeth to abound.

content: 29 Who hath woe? Who hath outcry of pain? Who hath contentions? Who hath complaining? Who hath needless wounds? Who hath dulness of eyes?
content_old: 29 Who hath woe? Who hath outcry of pain? Who hath contentions? Who hath complaining? Who hath needless wounds? Who hath dulness of eyes?

content: 30 They who tarry over wine, They who go in to search for mixed wine.
content_old: 30 They who tarry over wine, They who go in to search for mixed wine.

content: 31 Do not look on wine when it becometh red, When it giveth in the cup its sparkle, Glideth down smoothly.
content_old: 31 Do not look on wine when it becometh red, When it giveth in the cup its sparkle, Glideth down smoothly.

content: 32 lts after effect is that like a serpent it biteth, And like a viper it doth sting.
content_old: 32 lts after effect is that like a serpent it biteth, And like a viper it doth sting.

content: 33 Thine eyes will see strange women, And thy heart will speak perverse things:
content_old: 33 Thine eyes will see strange women, And thy heart will speak perverse things:

content: 34 So shalt thou become､ as one lying down in the heart of the sea,— Or as one lying down on the top of the mast-gear:
content_old: 34 So shalt thou become､ as one lying down in the heart of the sea,— Or as one lying down on the top of the mast-gear:

content: 1 Be not thou envious of wicked men, Neither crave to be with them;
content_old: 1 Be not thou envious of wicked men, Neither crave to be with them;

content: 2 For violence their heart muttereth, And mischief their lips do speak.
content_old: 2 For violence their heart muttereth, And mischief their lips do speak.

content: 3 In wisdom is a house builded, And in understanding is it established;
content_old: 3 In wisdom is a house builded, And in understanding is it established;

content: 4 And in knowledge chambers are filled, With all acquisitions､ costly and fair.
content_old: 4 And in knowledge chambers are filled, With all acquisitions､ costly and fair.

content: 5 A wise man is mighty, And a man of knowledge becometh alert in vigour.
content_old: 5 A wise man is mighty, And a man of knowledge becometh alert in vigour.

content: 6 Surely with concerted measures shalt thou make for thyself war, And success lieth in the greatness of the counsellor.
content_old: 6 Surely with concerted measures shalt thou make for thyself war, And success lieth in the greatness of the counsellor.

content: 7 Unattainable to a foolish man are the dictates of wisdom, In the gate he openeth not his mouth.
content_old: 7 Unattainable to a foolish man are the dictates of wisdom, In the gate he openeth not his mouth.

content: 8 He that deviseth to do mischief Him shall men call a master of plots.
content_old: 8 He that deviseth to do mischief Him shall men call a master of plots.

content: 9 The purpose of folly is sin, And an abomination to mankind is a buffoon.
content_old: 9 The purpose of folly is sin, And an abomination to mankind is a buffoon.

content: 10 Thou hast been slothful in the day of straitness, Strait is thy strength.
content_old: 10 Thou hast been slothful in the day of straitness, Strait is thy strength.

content: 11 Deliver thou such as are being led forth to death, And them who are tottering to slaughter oh that thou wouldst hold back!
content_old: 11 Deliver thou such as are being led forth to death, And them who are tottering to slaughter oh that thou wouldst hold back!

content: 12 Though thou say､ Lo! we knew not this Shall not he that proveth hearts､ himself discern? And he that formeth thy soul､ himself know? And bring back to a son of earth according to his deed?
content_old: 12 Though thou say､ Lo! we knew not this Shall not he that proveth hearts､ himself discern? And he that formeth thy soul､ himself know? And bring back to a son of earth according to his deed?

content: 13 My son､ eat thou honey､ because it is good,— And droppings from the comb because they are sweet to thy palate:
content_old: 13 My son､ eat thou honey､ because it is good,— And droppings from the comb because they are sweet to thy palate:

content: 14 Thus take knowledge of wisdom､ for thine own soul; If thou find it then there is a future, And thine expectation shall not be cut off.
content_old: 14 Thus take knowledge of wisdom､ for thine own soul; If thou find it then there is a future, And thine expectation shall not be cut off.

content: 15 Do not lie in wait､ thou lawless man､ against the home of the righteous,— Neither destroy thou his place of rest;
content_old: 15 Do not lie in wait､ thou lawless man､ against the home of the righteous,— Neither destroy thou his place of rest;

content: 16 For seven times may the righteous fall and yet arise, But lawless men shall stumble into calamity.
content_old: 16 For seven times may the righteous fall and yet arise, But lawless men shall stumble into calamity.

content: 17 When thine enemy falleth do not thou rejoice, And when he stumbleth let not thy heart exult:
content_old: 17 When thine enemy falleth do not thou rejoice, And when he stumbleth let not thy heart exult:

content: 18 Lest Yahweh see it､ and it be wicked in his eyes, And he turn away from him his anger.
content_old: 18 Lest Yahweh see it､ and it be wicked in his eyes, And he turn away from him his anger.

content: 19 Burn not with vexation against evildoers, Be not envious of lawless men;
content_old: 19 Burn not with vexation against evildoers, Be not envious of lawless men;

content: 20 For there shall be no future for the wicked, The lamp of the lawless shall go out.
content_old: 20 For there shall be no future for the wicked, The lamp of the lawless shall go out.

content: 21 Revere thou Yahweh､ my son､ and the king, And with the fickle have thou no fellowship;
content_old: 21 Revere thou Yahweh､ my son､ and the king, And with the fickle have thou no fellowship;

content: 22 For suddenly shall arise their calamity; And the misfortune of their years who knoweth?
content_old: 22 For suddenly shall arise their calamity; And the misfortune of their years who knoweth?

content: 23 These things also concern the wise, To take note of faces in judgment is not good.
content_old: 23 These things also concern the wise, To take note of faces in judgment is not good.

content: 24 He that saith to the lawless man､ Righteous thou art Peoples shall denounce him, Populations shall curse him;
content_old: 24 He that saith to the lawless man､ Righteous thou art Peoples shall denounce him, Populations shall curse him;

content: 25 But to reprovers one should be pleasant, And upon them should come an excellent blessing:
content_old: 25 But to reprovers one should be pleasant, And upon them should come an excellent blessing:

content: 26 Lips should one kiss With one who answereth in right words.
content_old: 26 Lips should one kiss With one who answereth in right words.

content: 27 Prepare in the open thy work､ And make ready in the field for thyself, Afterwards shalt thou build thy house.
content_old: 27 Prepare in the open thy work､ And make ready in the field for thyself, Afterwards shalt thou build thy house.

content: 28 Do not become a needless witness against thy neighbour, So mightest thou open too wide thy lips:
content_old: 28 Do not become a needless witness against thy neighbour, So mightest thou open too wide thy lips:

content: 29 Do not say— According to what he hath done to me So will I do to him, I will repay every one according to his work.
content_old: 29 Do not say— According to what he hath done to me So will I do to him, I will repay every one according to his work.

content: 30 By the field of the sluggard I passed, And by the vineyard of a man lacking sense;
content_old: 30 By the field of the sluggard I passed, And by the vineyard of a man lacking sense;

content: 31 And lo! There had come up all over it—thorns､ There had covered the face thereof—thistles, And the stone fence thereof had been thrown down.
content_old: 31 And lo! There had come up all over it—thorns､ There had covered the face thereof—thistles, And the stone fence thereof had been thrown down.

content: 32 So I observed it for myself､ I applied my heart, I looked—I accepted correction:
content_old: 32 So I observed it for myself､ I applied my heart, I looked—I accepted correction:

content: 33 A little sleep､ A little slumber, A little folding of the hands to rest:
content_old: 33 A little sleep､ A little slumber, A little folding of the hands to rest:

content: 1 These also are proverbs of Solomon,—which the men of Hezekiah king of Judah transcribed.
content_old: 1 These also are proverbs of Solomon,—which the men of Hezekiah king of Judah transcribed.

content: 2 The glory of God is to conceal a thing, But the glory of kings is to search out a thing.
content_old: 2 The glory of God is to conceal a thing, But the glory of kings is to search out a thing.

content: 3 The heavens for height､ and the earth for depth But the heart of kings cannot be searched.
content_old: 3 The heavens for height､ and the earth for depth But the heart of kings cannot be searched.

content: 4 Remove the dross from the silver And there cometh forth､ to the refiner､ a vessel:
content_old: 4 Remove the dross from the silver And there cometh forth､ to the refiner､ a vessel:

content: 5 Remove a lawless man from before the king That his throne may be established in righteousness.
content_old: 5 Remove a lawless man from before the king That his throne may be established in righteousness.

content: 6 Do not honour thyself before a king, Nor in the place of great men do thou stand;
content_old: 6 Do not honour thyself before a king, Nor in the place of great men do thou stand;

content: 7 For better it be said to thee､ Come up hither,— Than that thou be put lower down before a noble, Whom thine own eyes have beheld.
content_old: 7 For better it be said to thee､ Come up hither,— Than that thou be put lower down before a noble, Whom thine own eyes have beheld.

content: 8 Do not go forth to strive in haste,— Lest thou know not what to do in the latter end thereof, When thy neighbour hath put thee to shame.
content_old: 8 Do not go forth to strive in haste,— Lest thou know not what to do in the latter end thereof, When thy neighbour hath put thee to shame.

content: 9 Thy contention urge thou with thy neighbour, And the secret of another do not reveal:
content_old: 9 Thy contention urge thou with thy neighbour, And the secret of another do not reveal:

content: 10 Lest he that heareth expose thee, And the report concerning thee turn not away.
content_old: 10 Lest he that heareth expose thee, And the report concerning thee turn not away.

content: 11 Golden fruit in figured silver baskets Is a word spoken on fitting occasion.
content_old: 11 Golden fruit in figured silver baskets Is a word spoken on fitting occasion.

content: 12 A ring of gold､ and a vessel of precious metal Is a wise reprover､ on a hearing ear.
content_old: 12 A ring of gold､ and a vessel of precious metal Is a wise reprover､ on a hearing ear.

content: 13 As the cold of snow in the day of harvest Is a faithful messenger to them who send him,— When the life of his masters he restoreth.
content_old: 13 As the cold of snow in the day of harvest Is a faithful messenger to them who send him,— When the life of his masters he restoreth.

content: 14 Clouds and wind､ when rain there is none Is the man who boasteth himself of a pretended gift.
content_old: 14 Clouds and wind､ when rain there is none Is the man who boasteth himself of a pretended gift.

content: 15 By long patience is a judge persuaded, And a soft tongue breaketh the bone.
content_old: 15 By long patience is a judge persuaded, And a soft tongue breaketh the bone.

content: 16 Honey having found eat to suffice thee, Lest thou loathe it､ and vomit it forth.
content_old: 16 Honey having found eat to suffice thee, Lest thou loathe it､ and vomit it forth.

content: 17 Withhold thy foot from the house of thy neighbour,— Lest he be weary of thee､ and hate thee.
content_old: 17 Withhold thy foot from the house of thy neighbour,— Lest he be weary of thee､ and hate thee.

content: 18 A hammer and a sword､ and a sharpened arrow Is a man becoming a false witness against his neighbour.
content_old: 18 A hammer and a sword､ and a sharpened arrow Is a man becoming a false witness against his neighbour.

content: 19 A broken tooth and a faltering foot Is confidence in the treacherous､ in the day of danger.
content_old: 19 A broken tooth and a faltering foot Is confidence in the treacherous､ in the day of danger.

content: 20 As splendour of dress on a cold day—vinegar upon nitre So is a singer with songs､ unto a sad heart.
content_old: 20 As splendour of dress on a cold day—vinegar upon nitre So is a singer with songs､ unto a sad heart.

content: 21 If he that hateth thee hunger give him bread to eat, And if he be thirsty give him water to drink;
content_old: 21 If he that hateth thee hunger give him bread to eat, And if he be thirsty give him water to drink;

content: 22 For burning coals shalt thou be heaping upon his head,— And Yahweh will repay thee.
content_old: 22 For burning coals shalt thou be heaping upon his head,— And Yahweh will repay thee.

content: 23 A north wind bringeth forth rain And a face stirred with indignation a secretive tongue.
content_old: 23 A north wind bringeth forth rain And a face stirred with indignation a secretive tongue.

content: 24 Better to dwell on the corner of the roof Than a quarrelsome wife, and a house in common.
content_old: 24 Better to dwell on the corner of the roof Than a quarrelsome wife, and a house in common.

content: 25 As cold water to a thirsty soul So is a good report from a far country.
content_old: 25 As cold water to a thirsty soul So is a good report from a far country.

content: 26 A fountain fouled､ a spring spoiled Is a righteous man tottering before one who is lawless.
content_old: 26 A fountain fouled､ a spring spoiled Is a righteous man tottering before one who is lawless.

content: 27 To eat honey in abundance is not good, Nor is searching out their own honour an honourable thing.
content_old: 27 To eat honey in abundance is not good, Nor is searching out their own honour an honourable thing.

content: 1 As snow in summer､ and as rain in harvest So unbecoming to a dullard is honour.
content_old: 1 As snow in summer､ and as rain in harvest So unbecoming to a dullard is honour.

content: 2 As a sparrow in wandering､ as a swallow in flying So a causeless curse shall not alight.
content_old: 2 As a sparrow in wandering､ as a swallow in flying So a causeless curse shall not alight.

content: 3 A whip for the horse､ a bridle for the ass And a rod for the back of dullards.
content_old: 3 A whip for the horse､ a bridle for the ass And a rod for the back of dullards.

content: 4 Do not answer a dullard､ according to his folly, Lest even thou thyself become like him;
content_old: 4 Do not answer a dullard､ according to his folly, Lest even thou thyself become like him;

content: 5 Answer a dullard､ according to his folly, Lest he become wise in his own eyes.
content_old: 5 Answer a dullard､ according to his folly, Lest he become wise in his own eyes.

content: 6 One who cutteth off feet､ one who drinketh down wrong, Is he who sendeth a message by the hand of a dullard.
content_old: 6 One who cutteth off feet､ one who drinketh down wrong, Is he who sendeth a message by the hand of a dullard.

content: 7 Useless are the legs of the lame And a proverb､ in the mouth of a dullard.
content_old: 7 Useless are the legs of the lame And a proverb､ in the mouth of a dullard.

content: 8 Like tying a stone to a sling So is he that giveth honour to a dullard.
content_old: 8 Like tying a stone to a sling So is he that giveth honour to a dullard.

content: 9 A brier cometh into the hand of a drunken-man, A proverb into the mouth of dullards.
content_old: 9 A brier cometh into the hand of a drunken-man, A proverb into the mouth of dullards.

content: 10 As an archer who woundeth every thing, So one who hireth a dullard､ and a drunkard crossing the sea.
content_old: 10 As an archer who woundeth every thing, So one who hireth a dullard､ and a drunkard crossing the sea.

content: 11 As a dog returneth unto his own vomit A dullard repeateth his folly.
content_old: 11 As a dog returneth unto his own vomit A dullard repeateth his folly.

content: 12 Thou hast seen a man wise in his own eyes,— More hope of a dullard､ than of him!
content_old: 12 Thou hast seen a man wise in his own eyes,— More hope of a dullard､ than of him!

content: 13 Saith the sluggard､ A roaring lion in the road! A tearing lion in the midst of the broadways.
content_old: 13 Saith the sluggard､ A roaring lion in the road! A tearing lion in the midst of the broadways.

content: 14 The door turneth on its hinges And the sluggard upon his bed.
content_old: 14 The door turneth on its hinges And the sluggard upon his bed.

content: 15 The sluggard burieth his hand in the dish, He is too lazy to bring it back to his mouth.
content_old: 15 The sluggard burieth his hand in the dish, He is too lazy to bring it back to his mouth.

content: 16 Wiser is the sluggard in his own eyes, Than seven persons who can answer with judgment.
content_old: 16 Wiser is the sluggard in his own eyes, Than seven persons who can answer with judgment.

content: 17 As he who layeth hold of the ears of a dog Is a passer-by､ who giveth vent to his wrath over a quarrel not his.
content_old: 17 As he who layeth hold of the ears of a dog Is a passer-by､ who giveth vent to his wrath over a quarrel not his.

content: 18 As a madman throwing firebrands､ arrows and death
content_old: 18 As a madman throwing firebrands､ arrows and death

content: 19 So is a man who deceiveth his neighbour, And saith, Was not I in sport?
content_old: 19 So is a man who deceiveth his neighbour, And saith, Was not I in sport?

content: 20 Without wood a fire is quenched And where there is no tattler strife is hushed.
content_old: 20 Without wood a fire is quenched And where there is no tattler strife is hushed.

content: 21 Black coal to burning blocks､ and wood to fire So is a contentious man､ for kindling strife.
content_old: 21 Black coal to burning blocks､ and wood to fire So is a contentious man､ for kindling strife.

content: 22 The words of a tattler are dainties, They therefore go down into the chambers of the inner man.
content_old: 22 The words of a tattler are dainties, They therefore go down into the chambers of the inner man.

content: 23 Dross silver overlaid upon earthenware So are burning lips､ with a mischievous heart:
content_old: 23 Dross silver overlaid upon earthenware So are burning lips､ with a mischievous heart:

content: 24 With his lips the hater dissembleth, But within himself he layeth up deceit:
content_old: 24 With his lips the hater dissembleth, But within himself he layeth up deceit:

content: 25 Though he make gracious his voice do not trust him, For seven abominations are in his heart:
content_old: 25 Though he make gracious his voice do not trust him, For seven abominations are in his heart:

content: 26 Hatred may clothe itself with guile, His wickedness shall be disclosed in the convocation.
content_old: 26 Hatred may clothe itself with guile, His wickedness shall be disclosed in the convocation.

content: 27 He that diggeth a pit thereinto shall fall, And he that rolleth a stone upon himself shall it return.
content_old: 27 He that diggeth a pit thereinto shall fall, And he that rolleth a stone upon himself shall it return.

content: 1 Do not boast thyself of to-morrow, For thou knowest not what a day may bring forth.
content_old: 1 Do not boast thyself of to-morrow, For thou knowest not what a day may bring forth.

content: 2 Let another praise thee､ and not thine own mouth, A stranger and not thine own lips.
content_old: 2 Let another praise thee､ and not thine own mouth, A stranger and not thine own lips.

content: 3 Heavy is a stone､ and weighty is sand,— But the vexation of a fool is heavier than both.
content_old: 3 Heavy is a stone､ and weighty is sand,— But the vexation of a fool is heavier than both.

content: 4 The cruelty of rage､ and the overflow of anger! But who can stand before jealousy?
content_old: 4 The cruelty of rage､ and the overflow of anger! But who can stand before jealousy?

content: 5 Better is a rebuke that is open, Than love carefully concealed.
content_old: 5 Better is a rebuke that is open, Than love carefully concealed.

content: 6 Faithful are the wounds of a friend, But lavished are the kisses of an enemy.
content_old: 6 Faithful are the wounds of a friend, But lavished are the kisses of an enemy.

content: 7 The surfeited soul trampleth upon droppings from the comb, But to the hungry soul every bitter thing is sweet.
content_old: 7 The surfeited soul trampleth upon droppings from the comb, But to the hungry soul every bitter thing is sweet.

content: 8 As a bird wandering from her nest So is a man wandering from his place.
content_old: 8 As a bird wandering from her nest So is a man wandering from his place.

content: 9 Oil and perfume rejoice the heart, The sweetness of one’s friend more than fragrant wood.
content_old: 9 Oil and perfume rejoice the heart, The sweetness of one’s friend more than fragrant wood.

content: 10 Thine own friend and thy father’s friend do not thou forsake; But the house of thy brother do not enter､ in thy day of calamity, Better a neighbour near､ than a brother far off.
content_old: 10 Thine own friend and thy father’s friend do not thou forsake; But the house of thy brother do not enter､ in thy day of calamity, Better a neighbour near､ than a brother far off.

content: 11 Be wise､ my son､ and rejoice my heart, That I may answer him that reproacheth me in a matter.
content_old: 11 Be wise､ my son､ and rejoice my heart, That I may answer him that reproacheth me in a matter.

content: 12 A prudent man seeth calamity—he hideth himself, The simple pass on—they suffer.
content_old: 12 A prudent man seeth calamity—he hideth himself, The simple pass on—they suffer.

content: 13 Take a man’s garment when he hath become pledge for a stranger, Then for a female unknown accept him as surety.
content_old: 13 Take a man’s garment when he hath become pledge for a stranger, Then for a female unknown accept him as surety.

content: 14 He that blesseth his friend､ with a loud voice､ in the morning early A reproach shall it be reckoned to him.
content_old: 14 He that blesseth his friend､ with a loud voice､ in the morning early A reproach shall it be reckoned to him.

content: 15 A continuous dripping on a day of downpour, And a contentious wife are alike:
content_old: 15 A continuous dripping on a day of downpour, And a contentious wife are alike:

content: 16 He that hideth her hideth the wind, And perfume his right hand may proclaim.
content_old: 16 He that hideth her hideth the wind, And perfume his right hand may proclaim.

content: 17 Let iron by iron become sharp, And let a man sharpen the face of his friend.
content_old: 17 Let iron by iron become sharp, And let a man sharpen the face of his friend.

content: 18 He that guardeth the fig-tree shall eat the fruit thereof, And he that watcheth over his master shall be honoured.
content_old: 18 He that guardeth the fig-tree shall eat the fruit thereof, And he that watcheth over his master shall be honoured.

content: 19 As in water､ face answereth to face So the heart of man to man.
content_old: 19 As in water､ face answereth to face So the heart of man to man.

content: 20 Hades and destruction are not satisfied, And the eyes of a man are not satisfied.
content_old: 20 Hades and destruction are not satisfied, And the eyes of a man are not satisfied.

content: 21 Fining pot for silver､ and crucible for gold And a man is to be tried by what he praiseth.
content_old: 21 Fining pot for silver､ and crucible for gold And a man is to be tried by what he praiseth.

content: 22 Though thou pound a fool in a mortar､ amidst grain､ with a pestle His folly will not depart from him.
content_old: 22 Though thou pound a fool in a mortar､ amidst grain､ with a pestle His folly will not depart from him.

content: 23 Note well the appearance of thy flock, Apply thy mind to thy herds;
content_old: 23 Note well the appearance of thy flock, Apply thy mind to thy herds;

content: 24 For not age-abiding are riches, Nor is the diadem､ from generation to generation:—
content_old: 24 For not age-abiding are riches, Nor is the diadem､ from generation to generation:—

content: 25 The grass is taken away､ and the young shoot showeth itself, And the herbage of the mountains is gathered;
content_old: 25 The grass is taken away､ and the young shoot showeth itself, And the herbage of the mountains is gathered;

content: 26 There are lambs for thy clothing､ And for the price of thy field there are he-goats;
