content_old: 26 There are lambs for thy clothing､ And for the price of thy field there are he-goats;

content: 1 The lawless fleeth when no man pursueth, But the righteous like a lion are confident.
content_old: 1 The lawless fleeth when no man pursueth, But the righteous like a lion are confident.

content: 2 For the transgressions of a land many are the rulers thereof, But under an intelligent and discerning man stability is prolonged.
content_old: 2 For the transgressions of a land many are the rulers thereof, But under an intelligent and discerning man stability is prolonged.

content: 3 A poor man､ who oppresseth the helpless Is like a rain beating down､ leaving no food.
content_old: 3 A poor man､ who oppresseth the helpless Is like a rain beating down､ leaving no food.

content: 4 They who forsake instruction praise one who is lawless, While they who keep instruction are at strife with them.
content_old: 4 They who forsake instruction praise one who is lawless, While they who keep instruction are at strife with them.

content: 5 Wicked men consider not justice, But they who seek Yahweh consider everything.
content_old: 5 Wicked men consider not justice, But they who seek Yahweh consider everything.

content: 6 Better a poor man walking in his integrity, Than one who is crooked—turning two ways､ though he be rich.
content_old: 6 Better a poor man walking in his integrity, Than one who is crooked—turning two ways､ though he be rich.

content: 7 He that keepeth instruction is a son with discernment, But a companion of squanderers bringeth shame to his father.
content_old: 7 He that keepeth instruction is a son with discernment, But a companion of squanderers bringeth shame to his father.

content: 8 He that increaseth his substance by interest I and profit, For one ready to favour the poor doth gather it.
content_old: 8 He that increaseth his substance by interest I and profit, For one ready to favour the poor doth gather it.

content: 9 He that turneth away his ear from hearing instruction Even his prayer is an abomination.
content_old: 9 He that turneth away his ear from hearing instruction Even his prayer is an abomination.

content: 10 He that misguideth the upright into a hurtful way Into his own pit he himself shall fall, But men of integrity shall inherit good.
content_old: 10 He that misguideth the upright into a hurtful way Into his own pit he himself shall fall, But men of integrity shall inherit good.

content: 11 Wise in his own eyes is the man that is rich, But a poor man of discernment searcheth him out.
content_old: 11 Wise in his own eyes is the man that is rich, But a poor man of discernment searcheth him out.

content: 12 In the exulting of the righteous there is great glorying, But when the lawless arise a man must be sought for.
content_old: 12 In the exulting of the righteous there is great glorying, But when the lawless arise a man must be sought for.

content: 13 He that covereth his transgressions shall not prosper, But he that confesseth and forsaketh shall find compassion.
content_old: 13 He that covereth his transgressions shall not prosper, But he that confesseth and forsaketh shall find compassion.

content: 14 How happy the man who is ever circumspect, Whereas he that hardeneth his heart shall fall into calamity,
content_old: 14 How happy the man who is ever circumspect, Whereas he that hardeneth his heart shall fall into calamity,

content: 15 A growling lion､ and a ranging bear Is a lawless ruler､ over a poor people.
content_old: 15 A growling lion､ and a ranging bear Is a lawless ruler､ over a poor people.

content: 16 A leader may lack intelligence､ yet abound in oppressions, The hater of greed shall lengthen out days.
content_old: 16 A leader may lack intelligence､ yet abound in oppressions, The hater of greed shall lengthen out days.

content: 17 A man oppressed with a person’s blood Unto a pit shall flee､ let them not hold him back.
content_old: 17 A man oppressed with a person’s blood Unto a pit shall flee､ let them not hold him back.

content: 18 He that walketh with integrity shall be saved, But he that is crooked､ turning two ways shall fall in one.
content_old: 18 He that walketh with integrity shall be saved, But he that is crooked､ turning two ways shall fall in one.

content: 19 He that tilleth his ground shall have plenty of bread, But he that pursueth empty-heads shall have plenty of poverty.
content_old: 19 He that tilleth his ground shall have plenty of bread, But he that pursueth empty-heads shall have plenty of poverty.

content: 20 A man of fidelity aboundeth in blessings, But one hasting to be rich shall not be held innocent.
content_old: 20 A man of fidelity aboundeth in blessings, But one hasting to be rich shall not be held innocent.

content: 21 To take note of faces in judgment is not good, And for a bit of bread a man will transgress.
content_old: 21 To take note of faces in judgment is not good, And for a bit of bread a man will transgress.

content: 22 A man hasting to be rich hath an evil eye, And knoweth not when want may overtake him.
content_old: 22 A man hasting to be rich hath an evil eye, And knoweth not when want may overtake him.

content: 23 He that reproveth a man shall afterwards find more favour, Than he that useth a flattering tongue.
content_old: 23 He that reproveth a man shall afterwards find more favour, Than he that useth a flattering tongue.

content: 24 He that robbeth his father or his mother, and saith､ It is no transgression Companion is he to one who wasteth.
content_old: 24 He that robbeth his father or his mother, and saith､ It is no transgression Companion is he to one who wasteth.

content: 25 The ambitious in soul stirreth up strife, But he that trusteth in Yahweh shall be enriched.
content_old: 25 The ambitious in soul stirreth up strife, But he that trusteth in Yahweh shall be enriched.

content: 26 He that trusteth his own heart the same is a dullard, But he that walketh wisely the same shall be delivered.
content_old: 26 He that trusteth his own heart the same is a dullard, But he that walketh wisely the same shall be delivered.

content: 27 One who giveth to the poor shall have no want, But he that hideth his eyes shall receive many a curse.
content_old: 27 One who giveth to the poor shall have no want, But he that hideth his eyes shall receive many a curse.

content: 1 He that being often reproved stiffeneth his neck Suddenly shall be hurt､ and there bo no healing.
content_old: 1 He that being often reproved stiffeneth his neck Suddenly shall be hurt､ and there bo no healing.

content: 2 When the righteous become great the people rejoice, But when a lawless man beareth rule a people sigh.
content_old: 2 When the righteous become great the people rejoice, But when a lawless man beareth rule a people sigh.

content: 3 A man who loveth wisdom gladdeneth his father, But a companion of harlots destroyeth wealth.
content_old: 3 A man who loveth wisdom gladdeneth his father, But a companion of harlots destroyeth wealth.

content: 4 A king by justice shall establish a land,— But a man open to bribes bringeth it to ruin.
content_old: 4 A king by justice shall establish a land,— But a man open to bribes bringeth it to ruin.

content: 5 A man who flattereth his neighbour Spreadeth a net over his steps.
content_old: 5 A man who flattereth his neighbour Spreadeth a net over his steps.

content: 6 In the transgression of a wicked man is a snare, But the righteous doth shout in triumph and rejoice.
content_old: 6 In the transgression of a wicked man is a snare, But the righteous doth shout in triumph and rejoice.

content: 7 The righteous doth acknowledge the plea of the poor, But the lawless regardeth not knowledge.
content_old: 7 The righteous doth acknowledge the plea of the poor, But the lawless regardeth not knowledge.

content: 8 Men given to mockery inflame a city,— But wise men turn away anger.
content_old: 8 Men given to mockery inflame a city,— But wise men turn away anger.

content: 9 A wise man pleading with a foolish man Whether he rage or laugh there is no settlement.
content_old: 9 A wise man pleading with a foolish man Whether he rage or laugh there is no settlement.

content: 10 Blood-thirsty men hate the blameless man, And as for the upright they seek his life.
content_old: 10 Blood-thirsty men hate the blameless man, And as for the upright they seek his life.

content: 11 All his anger doth a dullard let go, But a wise man by keeping it back stilleth it.
content_old: 11 All his anger doth a dullard let go, But a wise man by keeping it back stilleth it.

content: 12 When a ruler giveth heed to the word of falsehood All his attendants become lawless.
content_old: 12 When a ruler giveth heed to the word of falsehood All his attendants become lawless.

content: 13 The poor man and the man of usury meet together, He that enlighteneth the eyes of them both is Yahweh.
content_old: 13 The poor man and the man of usury meet together, He that enlighteneth the eyes of them both is Yahweh.

content: 14 When a king judgeth faithfully the poor His throne to futurity shall be established.
content_old: 14 When a king judgeth faithfully the poor His throne to futurity shall be established.

content: 15 A rod with rebuke giveth wisdom, But a youth unrestrained bringeth shame to his mother.
content_old: 15 A rod with rebuke giveth wisdom, But a youth unrestrained bringeth shame to his mother.

content: 16 When the lawless become great transgression increaseth, But the righteous shall behold their ruin.
content_old: 16 When the lawless become great transgression increaseth, But the righteous shall behold their ruin.

content: 17 Correct thy son､ that he may give thee rest, That he may give delight to thy soul.
content_old: 17 Correct thy son､ that he may give thee rest, That he may give delight to thy soul.

content: 18 Where there is no vision a people is let loose, But he that keepeth instruction how happy is he!
content_old: 18 Where there is no vision a people is let loose, But he that keepeth instruction how happy is he!

content: 19 By words a servant will not be corrected, Though he perceiveth yet is there no answer.
content_old: 19 By words a servant will not be corrected, Though he perceiveth yet is there no answer.

content: 20 Thou hast seen a man hasty in his words,— There is more hope of a dullard than of him.
content_old: 20 Thou hast seen a man hasty in his words,— There is more hope of a dullard than of him.

content: 21 He that dealeth tenderly with his servant from childhood, In his after life shall have him for a son,
content_old: 21 He that dealeth tenderly with his servant from childhood, In his after life shall have him for a son,

content: 22 A man given to anger stirreth up strife, And he that exceedeth in wrath aboundeth in transgression.
content_old: 22 A man given to anger stirreth up strife, And he that exceedeth in wrath aboundeth in transgression.

content: 23 The loftiness of a man layeth him low,— But one of a lowly spirit shall attain unto honour.
content_old: 23 The loftiness of a man layeth him low,— But one of a lowly spirit shall attain unto honour.

content: 24 He that shareth with a thief hateth himself, An oath he heareth､ yet may not tell.
content_old: 24 He that shareth with a thief hateth himself, An oath he heareth､ yet may not tell.

content: 25 The fear of man setteth a snare, But he that trusteth in Yahweh shall be placed on high.
content_old: 25 The fear of man setteth a snare, But he that trusteth in Yahweh shall be placed on high.

content: 26 Many seek the face of a ruler､ But from Yahweh is the sentence of each one.
content_old: 26 Many seek the face of a ruler､ But from Yahweh is the sentence of each one.

content: 1 The words of Agur､ son of Jakeh､ even the oracle,— The utterance of the man､ for Ithiel, For Ithiel and Ucal.
content_old: 1 The words of Agur､ son of Jakeh､ even the oracle,— The utterance of the man､ for Ithiel, For Ithiel and Ucal.

content: 2 Surely more brutish am I than any man, Nor doth the understanding of a son of earth pertain to me;
content_old: 2 Surely more brutish am I than any man, Nor doth the understanding of a son of earth pertain to me;

content: 3 Neither have I learned wisdom, Nor the knowledge of the Holy Ones can I acquire.
content_old: 3 Neither have I learned wisdom, Nor the knowledge of the Holy Ones can I acquire.

content: 4 Who hath ascended the heavens and then descended? Who hath gathered the wind into his two hands? Who hath wrapped up the waters in a mantle? Who hath set up all the ends of the earth? What is his name and what the name of his son､ when thou knowest?
content_old: 4 Who hath ascended the heavens and then descended? Who hath gathered the wind into his two hands? Who hath wrapped up the waters in a mantle? Who hath set up all the ends of the earth? What is his name and what the name of his son､ when thou knowest?

content: 5 Every saying of God is refined, A shield is he to them who seek refuge in him.
content_old: 5 Every saying of God is refined, A shield is he to them who seek refuge in him.

content: 6 Do not add unto his words, Lest he convict thee､ and thou be found false.
content_old: 6 Do not add unto his words, Lest he convict thee､ and thou be found false.

content: 7 Two things have I asked of thee, Withhold them not from me､ ere yet I die:
content_old: 7 Two things have I asked of thee, Withhold them not from me､ ere yet I die:

content: 8 Vanity and falsehood remove far from me, Neither poverty nor riches give me, Feed me with the food appointed me:
content_old: 8 Vanity and falsehood remove far from me, Neither poverty nor riches give me, Feed me with the food appointed me:

content: 9 Lest I be full､ and deny､ And say— Who is Yahweh? Or lest I be impoverished and steal, And do violence to the Name of my God.
content_old: 9 Lest I be full､ and deny､ And say— Who is Yahweh? Or lest I be impoverished and steal, And do violence to the Name of my God.

content: 10 Do not slander a servant to his master, Lest he revile thee､ and thou be found guilty.
content_old: 10 Do not slander a servant to his master, Lest he revile thee､ and thou be found guilty.

content: 11 A generation! Its father it revileth, And its mother it doth not bless.
content_old: 11 A generation! Its father it revileth, And its mother it doth not bless.

content: 12 A generation! Pure in its own eyes, Yet from its filth hath it not been bathed,
content_old: 12 A generation! Pure in its own eyes, Yet from its filth hath it not been bathed,

content: 13 A generation! How lofty are its eyes, And its eyelashes uplifted.
content_old: 13 A generation! How lofty are its eyes, And its eyelashes uplifted.

content: 14 A generation! Swords are its teeth, And knives its incisors,— To devour the humbled out of the earth, And the needy､ from among men.
content_old: 14 A generation! Swords are its teeth, And knives its incisors,— To devour the humbled out of the earth, And the needy､ from among men.

content: 15 The vampire hath two daughters､ Give! Give! Three there are will not be satisfied, Four have not said､ Enough!
content_old: 15 The vampire hath two daughters､ Give! Give! Three there are will not be satisfied, Four have not said､ Enough!

content: 16 Hades､ And barrenness,— A land not satisfied with water, And fire､ that saith not､ Enough!
content_old: 16 Hades､ And barrenness,— A land not satisfied with water, And fire､ that saith not､ Enough!

content: 17 The eye That mocketh a father, And despiseth to obey a mother The ravens of the valley shall pick it out, And the young of the eagle shall eat it.
content_old: 17 The eye That mocketh a father, And despiseth to obey a mother The ravens of the valley shall pick it out, And the young of the eagle shall eat it.

content: 18 Three things there are､ too difficult for me, Yea four which I do not understand:
content_old: 18 Three things there are､ too difficult for me, Yea four which I do not understand:

content: 19 The way of an eagle in the heavens､ The way of a serpent on the rock,— The way of a ship in the heart of the sea, And the way of a man with a maid.
content_old: 19 The way of an eagle in the heavens､ The way of a serpent on the rock,— The way of a ship in the heart of the sea, And the way of a man with a maid.

content: 20 So is the way of a woman committing adultery,— She eateth､ and wipeth her mouth, And saith, I have done no iniquity!
content_old: 20 So is the way of a woman committing adultery,— She eateth､ and wipeth her mouth, And saith, I have done no iniquity!

content: 21 Under three things a land is stirred, Yea under four she cannot bear up:
content_old: 21 Under three things a land is stirred, Yea under four she cannot bear up:

content: 22 Under a servant､ when he reigneth, And a base man, when he is surfeited with food;
content_old: 22 Under a servant､ when he reigneth, And a base man, when he is surfeited with food;

content: 23 Under a hateful woman､ when she is married, And a handmaid when she driveth out her mistress.
content_old: 23 Under a hateful woman､ when she is married, And a handmaid when she driveth out her mistress.

content: 24 Four things there are､ the small of the earth,— Yet they are wiser than the wise:
content_old: 24 Four things there are､ the small of the earth,— Yet they are wiser than the wise:

content: 25 The ants､ a people not strong,— Yet prepare they, in summer､ their food;
content_old: 25 The ants､ a people not strong,— Yet prepare they, in summer､ their food;

content: 26 The conies､ a people of no power, Yet set they､ among the crags､ their house;
content_old: 26 The conies､ a people of no power, Yet set they､ among the crags､ their house;

content: 27 King is there none to the locusts,— Yet go forth in swarms､ do they all;
content_old: 27 King is there none to the locusts,— Yet go forth in swarms､ do they all;

content: 28 The lizard with hands reneweth its hold,— Yet the same is in the palaces of the king.
content_old: 28 The lizard with hands reneweth its hold,— Yet the same is in the palaces of the king.

content: 29 Three things there are which step along well, Yea four which excel in going:
content_old: 29 Three things there are which step along well, Yea four which excel in going:

content: 30 The lion､ hero among beasts, Which turneth aside from the face of no one;
content_old: 30 The lion､ hero among beasts, Which turneth aside from the face of no one;

content: 31 The greyhound､ or the he-goat,— And a king､ having a band of soldiers with him.
content_old: 31 The greyhound､ or the he-goat,— And a king､ having a band of soldiers with him.

content: 32 If thou hast acted basely by lifting thyself up,— If thou hast plotted evil put thy hand to thy mouth!
content_old: 32 If thou hast acted basely by lifting thyself up,— If thou hast plotted evil put thy hand to thy mouth!

content: 1 The words of Lemuel the king,— The strain which was taught him by his mother:—
content_old: 1 The words of Lemuel the king,— The strain which was taught him by his mother:—

content: 2 What､ my son? And what､ the son of my womb? Aye what, the son of my vows?
content_old: 2 What､ my son? And what､ the son of my womb? Aye what, the son of my vows?

content: 3 Do not give､ to women､ thy strength, Nor thy ways､ to them who ruin kings.
content_old: 3 Do not give､ to women､ thy strength, Nor thy ways､ to them who ruin kings.

content: 4 It is not for kings､ O Lemuel､ It is not for kings to drink wine, Nor for dignitaries to desire strong drink,
content_old: 4 It is not for kings､ O Lemuel､ It is not for kings to drink wine, Nor for dignitaries to desire strong drink,

content: 5 Lest he drink､ and forget that which is decreed, And alter the plea of any who are sorely oppressed.
content_old: 5 Lest he drink､ and forget that which is decreed, And alter the plea of any who are sorely oppressed.

content: 6 Give strong drink､ to him that is perishing, And wine､ to such as are embittered in soul:
content_old: 6 Give strong drink､ to him that is perishing, And wine､ to such as are embittered in soul:

content: 7 Let him drink､ and forget his poverty, And his wearying toil let him remember no more.
content_old: 7 Let him drink､ and forget his poverty, And his wearying toil let him remember no more.

content: 8 Open thy mouth for the dumb, For the cause of all the children of the departed.
content_old: 8 Open thy mouth for the dumb, For the cause of all the children of the departed.

content: 9 Open thy mouth—judge righteously,— And administer justice for the poor and the needy.
content_old: 9 Open thy mouth—judge righteously,— And administer justice for the poor and the needy.

content: 10 A virtuous woman who can find? For far beyond corals is her worth.
content_old: 10 A virtuous woman who can find? For far beyond corals is her worth.

content: 11 The heart of her husband trusteth her, And gain he shall not lack:
content_old: 11 The heart of her husband trusteth her, And gain he shall not lack:

content: 12 She doeth him good and not evil, All the days of her life:
content_old: 12 She doeth him good and not evil, All the days of her life:

content: 13 She seeketh wool and flax, and worketh willingly with her hands:
content_old: 13 She seeketh wool and flax, and worketh willingly with her hands:

content: 14 She is like the ships of the merchant､ From afar she bringeth in her food;
content_old: 14 She is like the ships of the merchant､ From afar she bringeth in her food;

content: 15 And she riseth､ while yet it is night､ And giveth food to her household, And a task to her maidens:
content_old: 15 And she riseth､ while yet it is night､ And giveth food to her household, And a task to her maidens:

content: 16 She considereth a field､ and procureth it, Out of the fruit of her hands she planteth a vineyard:
content_old: 16 She considereth a field､ and procureth it, Out of the fruit of her hands she planteth a vineyard:

content: 17 She girdeth､ with strength､ her loins, And putteth vigour into her arms:
content_old: 17 She girdeth､ with strength､ her loins, And putteth vigour into her arms:

content: 18 She tasteth､ whether good be her merchandise, And her lamp goeth not out by night:
content_old: 18 She tasteth､ whether good be her merchandise, And her lamp goeth not out by night:

content: 19 Her hands she putteth forth to the distaff, And her palms lay hold of the spindle:
content_old: 19 Her hands she putteth forth to the distaff, And her palms lay hold of the spindle:

content: 20 Her palm she spreadeth out to the oppressed, And her hands she extendeth to the needy:
content_old: 20 Her palm she spreadeth out to the oppressed, And her hands she extendeth to the needy:

content: 21 She feareth not､ for her household､ because of the snow, For all her household are clothed with crimson:
content_old: 21 She feareth not､ for her household､ because of the snow, For all her household are clothed with crimson:

content: 22 Coverlets she maketh for herself, Of white linen and of purple is her clothing:
content_old: 22 Coverlets she maketh for herself, Of white linen and of purple is her clothing:

content: 23 Known in the gates is her husband, When he sitteth､ with the elders of the land:
content_old: 23 Known in the gates is her husband, When he sitteth､ with the elders of the land:

content: 24 Fine linen wraps she maketh and selleth, And girdles doth she deliver to the trader:
content_old: 24 Fine linen wraps she maketh and selleth, And girdles doth she deliver to the trader:

content: 25 Strength and dignity are her clothing, And she laugheth at the time to come:
content_old: 25 Strength and dignity are her clothing, And she laugheth at the time to come:

content: 26 Her mouth she openeth with wisdom, And the instruction of kindness is on her tongue:
content_old: 26 Her mouth she openeth with wisdom, And the instruction of kindness is on her tongue:

content: 27 She looketh well to the goings of her household, And the bread of idleness will she not eat.
content_old: 27 She looketh well to the goings of her household, And the bread of idleness will she not eat.

content: 28 Her children rise up､ and call her happy! Her husband､ and he praiseth her:—
content_old: 28 Her children rise up､ and call her happy! Her husband､ and he praiseth her:—

content: 29 Many daughters have done virtuously, But thou excellest them all!
content_old: 29 Many daughters have done virtuously, But thou excellest them all!

content: 30 Deceitful is loveliness and vain is beauty, The woman that revereth Yahweh she shall be praised:
content_old: 30 Deceitful is loveliness and vain is beauty, The woman that revereth Yahweh she shall be praised:
